story:
Available for Android and iOS mobile devices. Campus Classifieds enables students to connect with their peers at their university to share textbooks that otherwise would go forgotten. 

Features




You Control Your Textbooks

Simply choose if you want to keep your textbooks or sell them. Keep track of all your textbooks with your in app log. 


Functionality

So... how do students use Campus Classifieds??? This graphics below shows how a student goes from login to using all the other features of the app.


Chat In App 


Chat in app with students to negotiate prices and learn more about the textbook before you buy or sell. This feature is private as to not share your personal contact information. 

Contributor Perks

Your contributions not only help with how knowledge and education will be shared, but you also get some Perks for contributing. Check them out on the sidebar. 


Purpose-Driven Design

1. Simplicity - For ease of use and successful bootstrapped development.

2. Affordable - FREE! That is how university students work... they like it free.

3. Convenient - Students are mobile around the clock, so is Campus Classifieds.

4. Modern - Its minimalist design keeps features and appearances fresh.  

*bootstrapped = startup with only necessary resources


Keep It Free

With University students already on a tight budget, Campus Classifieds is designed to save money. In app, non-obtrusive advertisements generate revenue to keep Campus Classifieds free to download and use. 

Words cannot express how grateful we are for your donations that help make Campus Classifieds possible. So we thought you might want to know where your helpful contributions go. 


Beat the Bookstore

Simply put, Campus Classifieds gives you savings for the same book. 


Search & Compare Options

Once students enter their search criteria they have the ability to browse and connect with the seller of their choice.  


For Anywhere & Anytime

Campus Classifieds is developed on a multi-device platform for convenience and mobility.  Students are busy and on the go, that is why Campus Classifieds is not  bound to a computer, kiosk, or store.

Where The Contributions Go


Words cannot express how grateful we are for your donations that help make Campus Classifieds possible. So we thought you might want to know where your helpful contributions go. 


Interesting Facts

- The average amount university students spend on higher education textbooks and materials is $1200. *

- Major textbook publishers like McGraw-Hill, Pearson & Cengage generate over $4 billion in revenue annually. *

- The average cost of living has increased 250% from 1980; textbooks have increased 850%. **

- At least 90% of college students own a cellphone, *** or an app-capable mobile device, allowing for simple access to Campus Classifieds on the Google Play & Apple App store.

Sources:

* UniversityBusiness.com

** HuffingtonPost.com

*** USNews.com


Meet the Creator 

Grant Kirkey is a Junior studying Supply Chain Management and Entrepreneurship at Bowling Green State University in NW Ohio, USA. With an eye for identifying problems and creating effective solutions, Grant has progressed from building skateboards out of his garage to creating Campus Classifieds today. For more information visit grantkirkey.com

story:
In Short:

Think of an auto rickshaw mixed with the car from Back to the Future. Add the tools from a maker space and the curriculum from a science or engineering class you wish you had in school. Now take that and set it in the heart of Mumbai. The Maker Auto will be a mobile link between the Makers’ Asylum (makersasylum.com)  and the greater community of Mumbai. We will be conducting workshops in collaboration with a variety of community groups, neighborhood associations, and nonprofit educational organizations from throughout the city.

The Goal:

The excitement and energy about innovation and building things in a makerspace is palpable, but how far can we extend that excitement? How can we bring that creativity energy to collaborations in the greater community of a Mumbai? India has countless people who make their living building things, but physical building activities are not often viewed as a respectable career path. Handwork is often associated with low wages and is not respected by many of India’s educated elite. Can we show the greater community that making and building things by is an essential part of some of the best innovations? Let’s work together to build a mobile platform for making collaboration to expand our community of changemakers.

Recipe:

Start with an auto rickshaw base.

Cut it in two equal sized chunks and remove the engine.

Stretch the two parts and recombine with engine.

Add two to four excited makers, a whole cabinet of high-tech tools, a few generous pinches of creativity, and a dash of adventuresome spirit.

Mix well.

Best if served fresh with a group of external collaborators.

Use:

After making an auto into the ultimate mobile maker space we will be conducting workshops with various groups around Mumbai and the surrounding area. Each individual project’s scope will remain flexible and change based on the group of collaborators we are working with. If we are working with a youth music program we can build DIY musical instruments. If we are working with medical students we can build assistive technology. With a neighborhood association we can build public furniture or playground equipment. A tech company can learn about 3D scanning and printing and an engineering class can learn about the power of user-centered design.

Who We Are:

As self-identified members of a ‘maker movement’ we seek out opportunities to take initiative and make change where we see fit. A maker space facilitates this attitude as well as the collaboration between individuals from a wide variety of fields. In these spaces engineers, designers, tinkerers, and technology experts are encouraged to come together and share their talents and expertise. The Maker Auto will be an extension of this space.

Coby Unger is a maker and designer and a professional amateur. In his design practice he likes to supplement his more serious work with playful projects. His recent endeavors include participatory youth-lead design-build projects, and low cost prosthetic devices, as well as playful public furniture, efficient cooking stoves and a remote control shark fin.

Sumit Rode studied Production Engineering at Mumbai University where he was a member of the Baja ATV team for two years. He formerly worked for Motomiu customizing Harley Davidson motorcycles. Sumit likes riding fast bikes and building complex robotic systems.

Nikhil Shinde is a third year Mechanical engineering student  at Rajiv Gandhi IoT, Versova. He is excited by creative projects, tight deadlines, and internal combustion engines. He has been a part of the AeroDesign club for his entire time at University and participated in the SAE AeroDesign competition in Texas in 2014. His newest project is leading Team RGIT  and building a formula type race car. He dreams of owning a garage and building cars, bikes, model aircrafts, etc.

Vaibhav Chhabra is a mechanical engineer, community organizer, entrepreneur and founder of The Makers’ Asylum, India’s largest and most vibrant maker space. When he is not hard at work on the next big thing for India’s maker movement, you might find him in the wood shop making custom furniture or tinkering with a new electronics project.


What We Need:

First and foremost, we are looking for more excited makers that want help make this plan into a reality. Do you have a passion for making that you want to share with others in your community? Do you work well with others? Do you have skills that you are eager to share? If so, we want you on our team.

Secondly, we need to buy materials and parts for the build. This includes an auto frame, a stronger engine, lots of other bits of steel, a completely new canopy, toolboxes, and a bunch of tools. Also, the intention is to offer the workshops from the Maker Auto for free, so we’ll need to buy materials for classes as well. This is a project for the community by the community. If you think making and building is something more people should have access, one way to show your support is by donating tools, equipment, or funds to the project. If we can get small donations from a large group of people we’ll be able to really make some great things happen.

Rewards:

Here are what some of the rewards will look like.

story:
Thank you for stopping by our indiegogo campaign!
We’re excited about our project and can’t wait to tell you all about it. Spoiler alert, there’s a lot of information we are eager to give you, but we thought starting with a summary of the What?, Why?  and Who? of the project will give you a good start!

What is the iUNITE™ platform?
iUNITE™ will be a software application designed to leverage real-time language translation, face recognition and mapping technology to produce a unique and effective learning experience through a culturally enriched music curriculum. The software will allow students from different parts of the world the ability to have direct hands-on communication with another group without the language differences being an issue. Real-time language translation will not only help motivate the students to engage, but it will open the doors of opportunity for groups of students to expand their knowledge of the world beyond their own communities and give them the chance to celebrate their own culture by teaching others about it, through their cultures music. The iUNITE platform is an innovative way to use real-time language translation technology to break down the language barrier on an educational level and we’re building a network of schools and youth organizations that will participate in the iUNITE platform. Did we mention, it’s pretty cool!

Why are we building the iUNITE platform?
There’s a quote by Nelson Mandela where he says “Education is the most powerful weapon, which you can use to change the world”. We strongly believe in Nelson Mandela’s message and feel that the education he spoke of is not limited to just your regular schooling, but is a starting point for a very vast category of education. We feel one of the most powerful influences in the world is music. Historically known as the universal language because it transcends cultures, it speaks to people regardless of their spoken language. It inspires, encourages, and makes you feel. We are going to build the iUNITE platform to allow students around the world the opportunity to explore worlds outside of the world they’re use to. In this day and age, we have great opportunity to use the advance technology available to us to bridge the gap between cities, countries and cultures. There’s a heavy sense of isolation, people are unknowledgeable of the world around them, misinformed and in many cases ignorant towards cultures other than their own. It breeds fear, ignorance and war. We feel it’s simple. Technology has granted us the open door to communicate in real time to someone on the other side of the planet, so why not develop a platform that can provide an educational system that allows younger students the ability to learn about any culture they want, directly from a group of students within that culture? Doing so can start the shift of ignorance to factual knowledge, in which can shift the way generations start to think about the world outside of their own and start to erase that fear and build open communication for generations to come.
 
Why do we need the money?
We need to start beta testing the iUNITE platform and In order to do that we need to hire the engineers and programers who can build out the software and run the testing. The funds raised will allow us to secure the right development team, help towards finalizing our marketing material and allow us to bring on more schools and youth organizations, which involves traveling and supporting a small team.

Who’s behind the iUNITE platform?
We’re not engineers, programers or silicon valley guys (Though we have a healthy love for tech, education and music :). We are a team of motivated individuals, led by two visionaries from the Bronx, NY who have a passion to do good in this world. Daimion John Peppers is a creative director, designer and web developer who started off in music entertainment and business management industries. Justin “Jus” Rolle is an entertainer, motivational life balance coach, who studied marketing and management. Together they co-own and operate micheck entertainment llc which is the company developing the iUNITE platform. micheck entertainment llc is a small entertainment company that started off in promotions and grew into artist management, strategic marketing and digital media design. Our team is small, but mighty and we pride ourselves on being visionaries at the forefront of change.
story_txt: Thank you for stopping by our indiegogo campaign!We’re excited about our project and can’t wait to tell you all about it. Spoiler alert, there’s a lot of information we are eager to give you, but we thought starting with a summary of the What?, Why?  and Who? of the project will give you a good start!What is the iUNITE™ platform?iUNITE™ will be a software application designed to leverage real-time language translation, face recognition and mapping technology to produce a unique and effective learning experience through a culturally enriched music curriculum. The software will allow students from different parts of the world the ability to have direct hands-on communication with another group without the language differences being an issue. Real-time language translation will not only help motivate the students to engage, but it will open the doors of opportunity for groups of students to expand their knowledge of the world beyond their own communities and give them the chance to celebrate their own culture by teaching others about it, through their cultures music. The iUNITE platform is an innovative way to use real-time language translation technology to break down the language barrier on an educational level and we’re building a network of schools and youth organizations that will participate in the iUNITE platform. Did we mention, it’s pretty cool!Why are we building the iUNITE platform?There’s a quote by Nelson Mandela where he says “Education is the most powerful weapon, which you can use to change the world”. We strongly believe in Nelson Mandela’s message and feel that the education he spoke of is not limited to just your regular schooling, but is a starting point for a very vast category of education. We feel one of the most powerful influences in the world is music. Historically known as the universal language because it transcends cultures, it speaks to people regardless of their spoken language. It inspires, encourages, and makes you feel. We are going to build the iUNITE platform to allow students around the world the opportunity to explore worlds outside of the world they’re use to. In this day and age, we have great opportunity to use the advance technology available to us to bridge the gap between cities, countries and cultures. There’s a heavy sense of isolation, people are unknowledgeable of the world around them, misinformed and in many cases ignorant towards cultures other than their own. It breeds fear, ignorance and war. We feel it’s simple. Technology has granted us the open door to communicate in real time to someone on the other side of the planet, so why not develop a platform that can provide an educational system that allows younger students the ability to learn about any culture they want, directly from a group of students within that culture? Our team is small, but mighty and we pride ourselves on being visionaries at the forefront of change.

story:
Andria Tupola

State House Representative

We create change.  I won as a first time candidate in 2014, and my journey with the community as a Representative for the State of Hawaii has been an amazing path of synergistic collaboration producing results with a fresh perspective. 

  • I am a wife - married 10 years
  • I am a mother - two beautiful daughters
  • I am a student - PhD music student studying "tone deafness"
  • I am a teacher - Elementary, middle school, high school, college, and community choir
  • I am a leader - KS song contest, University Student Body VP, Non-profit owner, Neighborhood board, State House Representative

What We Need & What You Get

We create change.  TOGETHER your contribution is going to help us increase our communication to the people of Hawaii and beyond:

  • Our goal is to raise $30,000 by June 3rd!
  • You can donate any amount! $1, $5, $25, $100, etc.  
  • You can choose a perk to get an inspirational message, personalized video, or a we can discuss your plans for change over lunch!
  • Our funds will help us communicate the message of change AND create the change needed.

The Impact

We create change is about helping others to reach their full potential through community, collaborating, communicating and connecting!

  • Community - We couldn't have done it with out the people in our community and their desire to help and contribute.  We were able to host the first "Wake Up West Side" emergency preparedness fair with federal, state, and city agencies.  We were able to clean Pa'akea road FOUR TIMES in preparation to making a bike path for the community.
  • Collaborating - We can't do it alone.  We were able collaborate with many members of community to move an unused portable out of the elementary parking lot up to the high school where it will be transformed into an athletic study hall.  We were able to collaborate with many people and groups to host two YW prom events and give out hundreds of free prom dresses to girls in the community.
  • Communicating - We hosted 18 town halls in the short span of a year and half.  These town halls were organized in many different areas of the community on focused on many different topics.  If people couldn't attend in person, we created an online town hall group for community members to discuss issues online and share ideas and solutions.  One of our biggest successes was creating an FB group called Westside Traffic Alert.  This is a very active FB group with more than 11,000 members who connect to share lane closures, accidents, commute times, and emergencies. 
  • Connecting - We supported businesses in the coast by hosting two entrepreneurship conferences to provide resources and create networking opportunities.  The most impactful connecting happened with we brought the owners of Nanakuli Food Giant, Keep It Flowing, LLC, Diverse Art, and many community members together to paint a 3,000 square foot landscape mural of the coast!! 

Risks & Challenges

It will not be easy.  There will be challenges and obstacles.  But where there's a will there's a way!

  • Serving the community and working for the state indefinitely comes with challenges, road blocks, and frustration.  There are many "no" people.  There are many mindsets that avoid change.  There are many ineffective and inefficient procedures and processes.  There are many who have lost hope. 
  • We have been able to problem solve through these with help from the community!  There may appear to be a lack of resources but there is no lack of will in our community which has helped us go above and beyond what we thought was possible.  There may appear to be a lack of money but there is no lack of people willing to collaborate.  There may appear to be a roadblock in the path forward but through communication we have found people on the other side of the road block to guide us around.  There may appear to be a lack of strength in numbers but we've been able to connecting people and synergize that strength!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can contribute in many ways!

  • If you can't financially contribute, you can share this video!
  • If you can't share this video, you can spread the word to your family and friends!
  • If you feel inspired, make your own video to encourage others to join our campaign for change!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
HOW IT ALL STARTED

Mia and Aleks met at Berlitz Language Center where they have been teaching English to both kids and adults (it was hip hop that got them talking). Soon, after having discussed many classes and students, they noticed a gap in the current curriculum, that students need more hands on activities when learning a language, and this is when Savvy began.We had both had this idea in our heads, and it was only natural that we should do something together. We applied for the Training Programme for Young Entrepreneurs, organized by the British Council; in January 2016 we attended workshops in Skopje and soonafter got recognition for our idea at the Pitch Competition that followed. 


MAKING THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE

We are inspired by kids and adults who want to improve themselves and thus create a better world. In May 2016 Savvy found its home in Blok 32, and this is where we are waiting for students to come and learn much more than just how to speak English. 

this is what Savvy looks like now -


help us make it even better!

Savvy is the first experiential learning language school in Belgrade, Serbia. Students will learn English through creative workshops such as yoga, dance, arts and crafts, cooking, drama, music and much more. We’ve been implementing this approach into our teaching and it has yielded tremendous results, where kids are not only excited to come to class but are gaining practical knowledge, and parents have become aware of this. We have been approached by both parents and students who are demanding that Savvy open in September. We already have a waiting list with over 20 names on it. With your help we can make it happen! 

learning, exploring, growing


We were able to procure a venue. But now we need your help to equip and furnish our school! The funds we raise will go towards a kitchen, which the students will use in an interactive cooking class. We also need fitness and music supplies and other props (such as a projector, stereo, computer lab, games) that will enable students to explore their talents and push the boundaries. Don’t think that adults can’t participate in this kind of fun learning. Adults will benefit greatly from Savvy courses, broaden their vocabulary, network and interests.

won't it look beautiful!


There are many language schools in Belgrade, but none offer practical skills and such interactive learning programs. Having organized and held numerous camps and workshops, we have seen the growing demand for this kind of approach, and we believe that our enthusiasm, encouragement we have been getting, as well as our experience will continue to be our driving force. During this process we have encountered various obstacles, which has only strengthened our bond and has pushed us forward. 

It motivates us when we see your excitement, so if you are unable to contribute financially, it means just as much if you spread the word and be part of Savvy's journey.


SAVVY TEAM

Mia and Aleks

Also, don't forget to visit our website
and like us on Facebook

story:
Inverted Valleys is part of a proposed series of laneway canopies that quickly create inviting public spaces while leaving the area beneath untouched and freely useable. With one of five sections built so far, out of more than 11 000 dowels, we are aiming to build the rest of this magical space by the end of the summer, and need your help to make it a reality!

About us:
Mark Francis is an intern architect and installation artist based in Toronto, Ontario. He received his Master of Architecture from the University of British Columbia in 2014, completed a BFA in visual arts at York University in 2010, and is currently working as a designer in the city Toronto.
Natalia Bakaeva is an intern architect and installation artist based in Toronto, Ontario. Natalia received her Master of Architecture and Urbanism from the London Metropolitan University (UK) in 2014, and her Bachelor of Architecture from Far Eastern Federal University (Russia) in 2012. She currently works as an intern architect at QBS in Toronto.

Inverted Valleys aspires to make a truly unique and contextually significant spatial intervention in the heart of Toronto's ravine system. By contributing to our crowd-funding campaign you will be helping to turn this dream of a place into a reality.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to build the entirety of the Don Valley portion of our installation, we are looking to raise at least 11 000 dollars.

This will cover the cost of materials, tools, transportation and labour for the four unbuilt sections, as well as the first section which has already been finished.

For each contribution bracket there are unique and amazing incentives as our way of saying thank you. These include: Official thank you in the booklet and online, a printed copy of the Inverted Valleys booklet, a 3D printed miniature section of the installation, or a section of the installation turned into an amazingly beautiful glass table.

We of course hope to build out our entire vision as planned, however if we do not meet our funding goal, we will still build as much of the installation as the funds raised allow. Either way, you are helping to build more of an amazing project!


The Impact

Every. Single. Contribution. Helps. Basically, the more we raise the more we get to build, and the more you get to come and experience and enjoy the space we created, until the end of October 2016. There is nothing to loose and everything to gain from helping us accomplish this goal. 

Inverted Valleys not only challenges us to think about the radical ways in which we use the leftover urban spaces to enliven our cities, it also aims to raise awareness about the magical ravines snaking their way all throughout our city.

By helping to finish this project you're implicitly helping to further the public discourse on these urban issues!


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute financially. That's ok, because the next best thing is to help us get the word out. Make sure to share our campaign page on your facebook/twitter/instagram profiles and get everyone you know participate in our amazing installation project! 

If you have any other ways you would like to help out, such as volunteering to build, let know by sending a message. All offers are appreciated!

story:
You can purchase by selecting any 'perk' on the right (or 'BACK IT' at the top). Just click or tap on the Ship Date -------------------------------->

Children learn so many life, language and social skills during their early years. They have learning aids for so many aspects of their development and growth.

I watched many young children struggle at mealtimes. My inspiration came when I stopped and really looked at the cutlery available to children.

I realised there was one key learning aid being overlooked that would make such a difference in so many children's day-to-day lives.

WHY ERGONOMICALLY DESIGNED CHILDREN'S CUTLERY?

Mealtimes highlight the difficulties almost all 4-5yr olds have in learning to use a knife and fork.  In schools, we’re reminded of this day after day. It’s become a ritual for parents and teachers to cut up food for children. This is of course necessary for toddlers, but when should this stop? There is an abundance of toddler cutlery on the market, but what comes next?

Meal times are a great opportunity for children to become independent as they grow. Using cutlery is a key life skill, once learnt correctly, learnt for life.

Teaching aids help children build confidence. Empowering children at an early age with the tools they need promotes independence. Many adults are conscious of the way they hold their cutlery, especially in social situations where they feel they may be judged by the way they eat.    

NANA'S MANNERS, UNIQUE DESIGN

Children are ready to use a knife and fork around the age of four. My cutlery should be introduced to 4-6yr olds. This is the age many children are ready to form a tripod grip.

I spent almost two years refining the shape of my handles so little fingers can only sit in the correct places.

The final manufactured cutlery handles will have a soft-to-the-touch, smooth finish. The two launch colours I've chosen and named are "Jeddie Orange" and "Borneo Green". 

FINE MOTOR SKILL DEVELOPMENT

Using the Tri-Pod grip principle also supports fine motor skill development. Every child needs to practice dexterity and coordination of movement in their early years. 

FINGER PLACEMENT STICKERS

When your child sits at the table to eat, they need to feel empowered and independent.

Children should feel they are learning this skill all by themselves. No adult help needed!  

Introducing Jeddie the orangutan! The stickers I have developed use a colourful, fun and engaging image of Jeddie the orangutan to aide children's first few uses! Jeddie plays peek-a-boo so children can easily match their index finger to the respective point of the cutlery.  Each set includes a sticker sheet for practice, making sure the grip becomes instinctive in no time! 

NANA'S CONVERSATION CARDS

Children love an audience when talking about things they find fun. My Conversation Cards are a little creative start in social confidence. Around the table whether at home or in a restaurant, creative thoughts soon become enjoyable conversations for little and large imaginations. Our packs of cards are great for parents and a fun way to create engaging table talk for little ones and grown ups too.

EATING OUT

Many restaurants cater for children’s appetites, although there's very little or no choice in the utensils that are offered. I've designed a washable, soft and compact carry case so mums and dads can easily pack their children's set wherever they go. 

Styled in navy blue, the Neoprene case is finished with an embroidered Nana, completing the perfect portable case for your child's favourite eating aid. The design for the case is completed and is now available as part of your purchase.

WHAT WILL YOUR SUPPORT ACHIEVE?

The first part of my production run has been self-funded. We have sourced a factory manufacturing high quality kitchen products and placed a deposit on the tooling needed to manufacture my cutlery. The process to make the tool has begun.

Your support at this stage enables me to manufacture the first run. I need your support to ensure my sale price of £18 is achievable come launch. Reaching my target will also give me the option of introducing new colours and I'll be asking our followers to join in and vote for their favourite through Nana's Manner's social channels!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT AT THIS STAGE

As a reward for your early support, I am offering you 20% off the list price. The cutlery will be £18.00 per unit when launched in September. As a very special thanks, you will also receive a free pack of Conversation Cards with your order. 

By supporting me now, your child will be amongst the first to receive their Nana’s Manners cutlery.

By pre-ordering your sets of cutlery, you are not just helping bring this one project to life. You are supporting the release of a great learning aide for every household with young children. You will be joining  a community that enjoys supporting children everywhere in promoting confidence and independence. 

 

Some of people starting the conversation about my children's cutlery: 

 

Please follow my journey and show  your support on Nana's Manners social channels;

HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?

The money will be used solely to produce and deliver the first edition sets of cutlery.

IF THE GOAL ISN'T REACHED?...

You will still receive your cutlery as the production run is going ahead. We will not, however, be able to add a third colour at this point. My retail price may also rise slightly on launch when I sell through my website in September.

INTERNATIONAL BACKERS

Carrier - We ship to most international countries via Royal Mail and Parcel Force Worldwide, to ensure the package is delivered to you safely in the shortest amount of time. If you would like to opt-in for another shipping method, please email us at info@nanasmanners.com

Duties & Taxes - Please be aware that all international shipments are subject to duties and taxes by your government and I'm afraid you will be responsible for paying that. All Indiegogo rewards will be declared 'gift', however, most countries will assess a value.

AND LASTLY...

The two launch colours I've chosen and named are "Jeddie Orange" and "Borneo Green". FINE MOTOR SKILL DEVELOPMENTUsing the Tri-Pod grip principle also supports fine motor skill development. Every child needs to practice dexterity and coordination of movement in their early years. FINGER PLACEMENT STICKERSWhen your child sits at the table to eat, they need to feel empowered and independent.Children should feel they are learning this skill all by themselves. No adult help needed!  Introducing Jeddie the orangutan! The stickers I have developed use a colourful, fun and engaging image of Jeddie the orangutan to aide children's first few uses! Jeddie plays peek-a-boo so children can easily match their index finger to the respective point of the cutlery.  Each set includes a sticker sheet for practice, making sure the grip becomes instinctive in no time! NANA'S CONVERSATION CARDSChildren love an audience when talking about things they find fun. My Conversation Cards are a little creative start in social confidence. Around the table whether at home or in a restaurant, creative thoughts soon become enjoyable conversations for little and large imaginations. Our packs of cards are great for parents and a fun way to create engaging table talk for little ones and grown ups too.EATING OUTMany restaurants cater for children’s appetites, although there's very little or no choice in the utensils that are offered. I've designed a washable, soft and compact carry case so mums and dads can easily pack their children's set wherever they go. Styled in navy blue, the Neoprene case is finished with an embroidered Nana, completing the perfect portable case for your child's favourite eating aid. The design for the case is completed and is now available as part of your purchase.WHAT WILL YOUR SUPPORT ACHIEVE?The first part of my production run has been self-funded. We have sourced a factory manufacturing high quality kitchen products and placed a deposit on the tooling needed to manufacture my cutlery. The process to make the tool has begun.Your support at this stage enables me to manufacture the first run. I need your support to ensure my sale price of £18 is achievable come launch. Reaching my target will also give me the option of introducing new colours and I'll be asking our followers to join in and vote for their favourite through Nana's Manner's social channels!THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT AT THIS STAGEAs a reward for your early support, I am offering you 20% off the list price. The cutlery will be £18.00 per unit when launched in September. As a very special thanks, you will also receive a free pack of Conversation Cards with your order. By supporting me now, your child will be amongst the first to receive their Nana’s Manners cutlery.By pre-ordering your sets of cutlery, you are not just helping bring this one project to life. You are supporting the release of a great learning aide for every household with young children. You will be joining  a community that enjoys supporting children everywhere in promoting confidence and independence.  Some of people starting the conversation about my children's cutlery:  Please follow my journey and show  your support on Nana's Manners social channels;HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?The money will be used solely to produce and deliver the first edition sets of cutlery.IF THE GOAL ISN'T REACHED?...You will still receive your cutlery as the production run is going ahead. We will not, however, be able to add a third colour at this point. My retail price may also rise slightly on launch when I sell through my website in September.INTERNATIONAL BACKERSCarrier - We ship to most international countries via Royal Mail and Parcel Force Worldwide, to ensure the package is delivered to you safely in the shortest amount of time. If you would like to opt-in for another shipping method, please email us at info@nanasmanners.comDuties & Taxes - Please be aware that all international shipments are subject to duties and taxes by your government and I'm afraid you will be responsible for paying that. All Indiegogo rewards will be declared 'gift', however, most countries will assess a value.AND LASTLY...

story:
Summary

Think of the college career fair experience for a minute.  Imagine yourself back in those fancy shoes, the long lines, the mechanical responses to the same generic questions, your sweaty palms, and your feigned interest in booth after booth.  How could you possibly know what the job was really going to be like in this setting?  You could throw a dart, and be well on your way to a career you guessed at.  Or you could look for a better way online.  Surely there were useful intern testimonials somewhere online right? Sadly, no. 

Glassdoor.com does a great job of showing reviews for full-time positions, but not very effectively for internships.  Online internship posting platforms like Indeed.com and Internships.com display job descriptions but with no authentic intern testimonial about what to really expect.  The Internwire.com founding team lived this experience across multiple universities, and vowed to deliver the platform that provides a complete solution to the internship process- completely free for students.

We have the Internet, and we're not afraid to use it!

Millions of university students across America use Ratemyprofessors.com to hand-select the best-reviewed professors before scheduling their classes.  It is time that students have a platform that offers the exact same power when seeking internships!  InternWire.com is that platform.  Now students everywhere will have the ability to post internship reviews, and enjoy reviews across any industry, any major, at any time.  It is time that every university student knows all of their options, and chooses their career from abundance instead of scarcity.

But our improvement in internship clarity doesn't end there! We understand that today's college students are much more interested in tapping through Snapchat stories than reading through generic company descriptions.  To best serve the interns of today, we are also becoming the first platform to show students internship opportunity videos from inside the company's walls.  At last! You as a student will know what your desk might look like, what sense of humor your boss has, and hear straight from the program manager about future career opportunities an intern at that company can expect.

With the help of your contribution, we will be able to launch and spread InternWire.com to university students across America.  This means thousands and thousands of reviews for students to efficiently search and filter through, and quickly find the direction to the career of their dreams!

A Viable Business Model

It is important to note that this is not just a charity effort for students. InternWire.com has a viable, validated business model consisting of five steps:

Step 1) Create a free and incredibly helpful platform for university students seeking internships.

Step 2) Use modern marketing techniques to reach university students in order to generate lots and lots of intern traffic on InternWire.com.

Step 3) Sell opportunities for employers to advertise their programs more effectively to the intern population on InternWire.com, at a lower cost than current intern advertisement methods.

Step 4) Reinvest in the company, continuously perfecting a platform that positively impacts the career decisions of thousands of students.

Step 5) Donate a dollar for every review to charity Pencils of Promise, in order to spread the gift of education throughout the Human Family.

As of August 2016, InternWire is nearly finished with Step 1!  Our beautifully designed website (we like to call it InternWire.com 2.0) will be totally finished by early September, just in time for students to prepare before career fair season.  See work-in-progress pictures of the new site below!  Special thanks to our contracted development company BlGrafika for their expertise and hard work, as well as Brianna Branco who is our Marketing and Design genius.  Sorry employers, she's ours and you can't have her.

The InternWire.com team works every day of the week on market research, business development, career center outreach, design, development, consultation, learning and innovation in order to ensure that we deliver on our promise to our dearest intern colleagues.  The founding team has even turned down multiple Fortune 500 full-time Engineering positions in order to develop this platform.  This is going to happen.  The InternWire.com team is completely committed to helping interns everywhere find the path to the career of their dreams.

Let's Talk Numbers

We would never come to you asking for your hard-earned money without us first doing our homework. Lots of it.
  • According to a 2014 NACE research study, a student with paid internship experience at a for-profit company will receive on average a 20%-25% higher starting salary versus a student with no internship experience. 
  • However among university seniors, 37% had no experience. InternWire.com aims to allow all students the opportunity to earn this increased financial security, and ensure that interns have the ability to do the research that directs them to the career they love and can thrive at, instead of just surviving.
  • We have calculated that the average career fair costs employers at very least $6.23 per handshake with an intern.  Advertising on InternWire.com will allow employers to reach interns and collect resumes for a fraction of that cost, without ineffective and frustrating pop-up advertisements.
  • Students with paid internship experience at a for-profit company see a 26% increase in full-time job placement.  Enabling more internships means enabling better placement rates for colleges around the country and more peace of mind for graduates entering the real world.
  • Our intensive surveys have indicated that a staggering 99.1% of students surveyed are interested in using InternWire.com for posting and searching internship reviews.  What's more, 97.5% of students surveyed showed great interest in internship opportunity videos.

Together We Can

InternWire.com is seeking to accomplish our $15,000 goal in order to offset a significant portion of our website development costs.  By getting debt out of the way, we will be able to launch our site and then use subsequent advertisement revenue directly towards spreading the word of InternWire.com to college campuses across America.  We have worked hard to make sure that InternWire.com is the right product to totally satisfy the needs of university students when it is delivered. Your donation allows that delivery to happen.

If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will have to significantly delay launch of our website in order to first pay off our debts.  This is why every donation is cherished!  If you believe in the platform described above, and believe that it would be useful to either yourself or a student you know, we would greatly appreciate you backing your belief with a donation, and sharing this page.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that money doesn't grow on trees.  If you truly cannot donate, please text a link to this campaign to someone who you believe could contribute.  Nearly everyone has either had an internship, is looking for an internship, or knows someone who is.  You are a rockstar!

story:
PepperSpray's objective is to continue the tradition of providing independent, non-commercial news and information. Our way of doing that is centered around media diversity. Through a variety of different mediums PSM creates and provides informative content, meant to be shared through today's social media landscape. In addition to easily shareable content, PSM is also producing long form videos, like documentaries, and textile media such as clothing and posters.

When the original PepperSpray Productions officially disbanded, a few video projects had been started that subsequently were left unfinished. As part of PepperSpray's re-birth, completing these are a priority. The three main projects focus on homelessness in Seattle, the election process, and local organization, the Seattle Solidarity Network (SeaSol). The footage for these is gathered, they just need to be edited together.

In addition to completing PepperSpray's former projects and continuing some of its traditions, PSM has also started new media series and brands that an audience is being built for. With its biggest expense covered by this funding PSM can afford to expand its membership and start an internship program to help complete these planned projects and create more.

 

 

PepperSpray Media is asking for $10,000. The money raised will be used to provide PSM with an office and art space for a year. $6,300 will cover 12 months rent for the space. $1,200 will cover 12 months of bills and utilities for the space. The remaining $2,500 will be used to emergencies and other miscellaneous things that may occur. With those major expenses covered PepperSpray can focus on creating content instead of constant fundraising (corporate sponsorship will never be an option).

In exchange for your contribution PepperSpray invites you to join our email list where you will receive our monthly newsletter and be informed about upcoming PepperSpray Media projects. PSM also has an array of gifts to give in exchange for your donation:

  • postcards - from #WelcomeToSeattle page

 

  • mixtapes - PSM curated a mixtape for Black History Month last year that contained songs and historical soundbites that pertained to the Black American experience

 

  • posters/prints - PSM has designed a few posters exclusively for this campaign and are available multiple formats

 

  • clothing - PSM will be offering silk screened t-shirts and tank tops with two different designs in two different colors

 

 

PepperSpray began as a product of the Seattle World Trade Organization (WTO) protest, more commonly known as, "The Battle in Seattle". As the activist video collective, PepperSpray Productions, PepperSpray continued to produce social and politically conscious videos long after the WTO protest ended. After more than ten years of activist video work PepperSpray Productions disbanded. Now PepperSpray has returned as PepperSpray Media with the same video activist objectives and a new transmedia focus that it will use on older PepperSpray Productions projects that had to be left unfinished as well as new PepperSpray Media projects.

 

 

PepperSpray Productions projects

  • Homeless in Seattle - This started as a documentary about homelessness in Seattle and how it relates to homelessness in the nation as a whole. A lot of footage was gathered for this project from protest, interviews with homeless Seattle residents and activists as well as a few crucial moments from Nicklesville. This footage could best be used for a web series about homelessness rather than one documentary. It would be more immediate and allow the project to tell more about the issues of homelessness in the city.
  • the election process - This project is an examination of the American electoral process and history. It started as a small piece on the election process, but with the wide range of footage gathered from the historic 2008 election of Barack Obama to expert interviews on gerrymandering the project ballooned into a larger more in-depth piece. This is now something that would be more effective as a web series and political activist platform.
  • Seattle Solidarity (Sea Sol) project - This documentary about the activist collective was suspended in the middle of post-production. PSM intends on finishing the production and use it as a launching pad for a web series that can draw attention to different campaigns carried out by Sea Sol.

 

PepperSpray Media projects

  • The Seattle Black Panthers documentary - Despite being started at the end of PepperSpray Productions' existence focus on this documentary has never stopped completely evidenced by the years of content aggregated and shared on the tumblr and facebook pages dedicated to the film. Renewed energy in PepperSpray helps expedite this production with more resources like time and interns.
  • Octopie videos - A web series that documents the development of a wood powered, gasification based pizza oven. The overall point of the series is to educate people on alternative fuel sources.

 

 

JWMediaPost

JW! Media Post is dedicated to presenting news and other media that focus on the prison industrial complex, particularly in the United States of America.

  • JW!MP Facebook page
  • JW!MP Twitter page

 

206 BPP

An extension of SeattleBPPfilm.com, this tumblr focuses on the philosophies of the Black Panther Party as a whole which includes (but is not limited to) anti-fascism, anti-imperialism, proletarian internationalism, anti-racism, and community organizing.

  • 206BPP Facebook page
  • 206BPP Twitter page

 

Film n' Life

FILM n' LIFE takes PepperSpray's mission and applies it to the world of film & video with a focus on sociopolitical films, independent films, documentaries, and the filmmakers that create them. FnL helps permeate the power that movies have to change a society while also encouraging and informing filmmakers and film fans.

  • FnL Facebook page
  • FnL Twitter page

 

 

Every bit of support helps. So even if you cannot make a financial contribution sharing a link to this campaign can be a big help too.

  • Follow PepperSpray on tumblr
  • Like PepperSpray on facebook
  • Follow PepperSpray on twitter
  • Visit pepperspraymedia.com

JW!MP Facebook page
JW!MP Twitter page

206BPP Facebook page
206BPP Twitter page

story:
AbcEdu.Online

Learn languages as an enriching experience

Today the traditional learning techniques have been replaced with new methods which revolutionize the language learning and acquisition process. AbcEdu’s aim is not to debunk what is already on the market, but to come up with a flexible and efficient online tool for all those willing to learn and achieve mastery in a foreign language, with minimum effort and low costs.

AbcEdu integrates the innovative and up-to-date teaching techniques with the valuable help of our expert teachers, who have designed the lessons as short and intense e-learning sessions. One of the major advantages of the online lessons is the way they are explained and visually supported by images that make learning a foreign language an easy and enjoyable experience.

 The video courses are tailored to incorporate various methods into teaching and accommodate different learning styles, so that they can be a perfect fit for each student, regardless of their knowledge level or of what they have learnt in schools.

The e-learning platform is optimized for computer as well as tablet and mobile phone. The classes are FullHD and can be accessed online from any device.

 

If you still wonder why AbcEdu?

For at least 3 reasons:

  1. First and foremost, each lesson is taught in the native language, with the visual support perfectly integrated in the context. The communication is adapted to each student and to real-life situations, in a friendly and easy manner.
     
  2. Second, the students can study at their own pace and in order to enhance their concentration and comfort level, the subtitles are available either in the students’ native language or in the language they want to learn 
     
  3. And last but not least, the students can measure their performance and progress by doing multiple choice tests, an extremely efficient technique to review vocabulary and refine grammar.

At the beginning, AbcEdu will provide English, Spanish, Italian and German classes. Later on, with your support, we will add courses in other languages and also come up with more and more subtitles in various languages for the video classes to be useful in more and more countries.


Press CC to display subtitles for the video
Download Pdf script for this video lesson
 

Press CC to display subtitles for the video
Download Pdf script for this video lesson
 

Press CC to display subtitles for the video
Download Pdf script for this video lesson
 

Help others to learn

Furthermore, those of you who do not need to learn a foreign language can facilitate other people’s access to this easy programme. To encourage this, AbcEdu will subtitle classes in Arabic to help the refugees. Those who wish to help them for a better life can do it with discount packages of up to 99 % .

If you cannot contribute financially to this project, you can still help by spreading the word, telling your friends and colleagues about us and sharing our project on social networks.

We are very grateful for your help! Thank you!

At the beginning, AbcEdu will provide English, Spanish, Italian and German classes. Later on, with your support, we will add courses in other languages and also come up with more and more subtitles in various languages for the video classes to be useful in more and more countries.

Press CC to display subtitles for the video

Download Pdf script for this video lesson 


Press CC to display subtitles for the videoDownload Pdf script for this video lesson 

Press CC to display subtitles for the video

Download Pdf script for this video lesson 

Help others to learn
Furthermore, those of you who do not need to learn a foreign language can facilitate other people’s access to this easy programme. To encourage this, AbcEdu will subtitle classes in Arabic to help the refugees. Those who wish to help them for a better life can do it with discount packages of up to 99 % .
If you cannot contribute financially to this project, you can still help by spreading the word, telling your friends and colleagues about us and sharing our project on social networks.
We are very grateful for your help! Thank you!

story:
A message from Mary Jo Henderson, Founder of HerScan: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L04ItUnH6G4

The money raised will be used to place 6 more mobile medical teams and clinics in newly opened states.
1.Acquire 5 vans and 1 HerScan Community Coach for medical testing and education.
2. Purchase 6 ultrasound machine.
3.Add phase 2 of tele radiology system to provide significant cost saving of mailing test results to radiologists and customers, thereby improving customer reporting with online access to personal protected portals in order to obtain their test results.
4. Additional staffing for medical teams and office management.
5. Obtain PR firm to continue the strong branding of the HerScan brand. As well as add to our new product announcements.
6. Increase our social media marketing platforms to our existing 20,000 customer database.

Joan Lunden on her blog "Joan's Blog" wrote ,"The HerScan program makes it easy for women to DO MORE for their breast health regimen toward the prevention and early detection of Breast Cancer."

Doing More in the fight against Breast Cancer with Easy Access to Ultrasound Technology

Easy Access to Ultrasound Technology has been challenging and is an important issue facing women today. Breast cancer is the most common cancer among women worldwide.( WHO)

Studies confirm that mammography misses every other cancer in dense breasts. (AreYouDense.org) The problem is nearly half the female population in this country have dense breast tissue.

Early detection is everything in the fight against Breast Cancer.

Mammography is recognized as the best preventative screening tool to image the breast, but falls short when imaging women with dense breasts as its imaging technique cannot see well through dense breast tissue. Cancer shows up in white in mammography and so does dense breast tissue. (It’s like trying to find a snow ball in a snowstorm.)

Ultrasound technology is an excellent tool to image the Breast and can see cancers that cannot be seen on a mammogram. An ultrasound images all the way to the chest wall.

While insurance companies can make it difficult to have access to Ultrasound; that is unless something is seen on a Mammography screening, and mammography misses every other cancer in women with dense breast, (Berg,et al) women can’t get access to Ultrasound easily.

A Florida based company, HerScan, Inc. and the HerScan program make it easy for women to have access to important Ultrasound whole breast screenings, enabling women to DO MORE for their breast health regimen toward the prevention and early detection of Breast Cancer.

The HerScan mobile medical clinics are being offered throughout several states, Monday - Saturday and are expanding services to provide important access to powerful state-of-the-art Ultrasound technology, using Board Certified Radiologists, and highly experienced RDMS Breast specialized Sonographers, with a program that helps save lives.

Educational materials are provided at each HerScan Health Event, helping women learn about dense breast tissue and the importance of asking their doctors the question; “Do I have dense breast tissue?”. (Journal of National Cancer Institute)

The HerScan Cares Program was created and is available for those women most in need, which provides free ultrasound screening.

Bridging these technologies result in significantly higher detection rates of breast cancer from approximately 47% to 98% than mammography alone. (Berg, 2012) ( AreYouDense.org) The HerScan Program bridges technologies with the addition of Easy Access to ultrasound.

Mammography alone is not enough for all women.

Breast Density Notification Laws by State — Breast density notification laws have been put into effect in 27 states. A breast density notification law requires that physicians notify women who have undergone mammography and were found to have dense breast tissue. The intent of such a law was to give women the necessary information to decide on further action if they had dense breast tissue. Dense breast tissue makes it harder to identify cancer on a mammogram and may also be associated with an increased risk of breast cancer, according to the American College of Radiology (ACR). Women with dense breasts are encouraged to discuss with their physicians their possible increased risk of breast cancer and the difficulty that mammography may have in detecting tumors.

For more information go to HerScan.com

References:

Berg, WA., Zhang, Z., Lehrer, D., Jong, RA., Pisano, E.D., Barr, R.G., Bohm-Velez, M., Mahoney, MC., Evans, WP., Larsen, L.H., Morton, M.J., et al. (2012) “Detection of breast cancer with addition of annual screening ultrasound or a single screening MRI to mammography in women with elevated breast cancer risk. “ Journal of American Medical Association. April 4; 307 (13): 1394-1404.

Yaghiyan, L., Colditz, G., Collins, L., Schnitt, S., Rosner, B., Vachon, C., Tamini, R. (2010) “Mammographic breast density and subsequent risk of breast cancer in postmenopausal women.” Journal National Cancer Institute. August 3; 103(15): 1179-1189.

World Health Organization website: http://www.who.int/cancer/detection/breastcancer/en/

Are you dense website: http://www.areyoudense.org

story:
REACTIVATING UNDERUSED SPACE

​

The site we have chosen for this year's intervention is on the grounds of the  Centro Cultural Miguel Angel Asturias (CCMAA). At the base of the cultural center we have designed  a new grand entrance and public plaza. An experiential path connects the market, civic centre and street to the Teatro Nacional. Behind the path is a public outdoor space, sheltered by a large colorful canopy, housing new cultural activities and providing a resting place for visitors.


THE IMPACT


FUNdaMENTAL focuses on the improvement of underused spaces and the creation of cultural programming through design. CCMAA's eight hectares of park and cultural buildings have experienced years of neglect and disuse. Our intervention will be the first step in a long process of civic and cultural renewal.


WHAT WE NEED

We are currently in the prototyping stage of playAchomo and are in contact with suppliers. Funds raised will go towards materials and other construction costs, including delivery. Money raised will also go towards our grand opening as part of the Festival Centro Historico in August.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

As we continue to develop playAchomo we are in need of your support.  Donate, participate, and spread the word!

FUNdaMENTAL is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of FUNdaMENTAL] must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Short Summary

Mohammad Saradeeh, aka Joker has faced numerous challenges but was able to cope because of his talent in music namely writing rap songs. I was able to get him a partial scholarship from a folk school in Denmark last year, and collected an amount to send him to Denmark to study music for 4 months - around the same time of the year last year. They loved him and gave him two additional partial scholarships Jan-June 2015 & Feb.-June 2016.

The plan is basically to find 150 people who are willing to donate each USD100 and on their turn ask three people to do the same. This way we’ll be able to fundraise what should also cover his university education in music.

The funds will be received and managed by IBDAA (a credible NGO in Jordan). Below is more details about Joker, breakdown of the amount to be collected and IBDAA.

You can help through one or more of the following:

1)  donating an amount of USD100

2)  Finding three other friends/relatives willing to donate the amount of USD100 each

3)  Sharing the campaign and updates via social media platforms at least twice a week

4)  Finding 10 people who are willing to donate each USD100

Please skim through the brief Story below!

Thank you! 

The Story

Meeting Joker...

When I first met Mohammad Saraddeh (aka Joker) he was 16 years old. I met him as part of a project I have been working for at Talbieh Camp, a Palestinian refugee camp in Jordan. He immediately captured my heart with his warm smile and positive attitude. At that time, Joker had been out of school for around two years and he was at great risk given the harsh conditions at the camp and his particular circumstances. A team of committed individuals and I worked with Joker to help him return to school and successfully finish the tenth grade which is considered a crucial milestone in the Jordanian educational system.


Joker continues to light...

Joker’s passion has always rested in rapping. He wrote rap songs that helped him cope with hardships, and allowed him to express his thoughts about injustices that he has perceived around him and challenge stereotypes about his community – the refugee community. In a song he wrote to respond to people who discriminate against camp dwellers and perceive youth in the camps as lazy, unintelligent, criminal, and alien Joker says:

In our camp we have creative youth

If the night falls, they continue to light

...and Joker’s creativity paid off. It took him back to school, helped him produce a small music album with support of the project that we ran in the camp, and made people believe in his talent. 


Joker performing in Amman, Jordan during an event aimed at raising awareness on the conservation of the environment. 

Joker performing in Amman, Jordan for an event that aimed at making some Syrian refugee children happy. 

Joker performing in Amman, Jordan during an event aimed at raising awareness on the conservation of the environment. 

He received a generous partial scholarship from a folk school in Denmark (Brandbjerg Hojskole) to attend one semester from August to Dec. 2014. Joker was able to attend such an opportunity through the help of individual friends, who either met or heard from me about him, covering his travel costs, pocket money and the remaining amount of the tuition. While for some this is a valuable learning opportunity, for Joker it has been rather a life saving opportunity.  

Joker made me and all of those who believed in him proud. His teachers and the Brandbjerg school staff have been very happy with his performance. He has also started already paying back to society by helping with Syrian refugees in Denmark through his school. So the school decided to give him another partial scholarship to attend one more semester Jan-June 2015 and another one from Feb.June 2016!


While this is great news, it is not enough. Joker needs to feel there is hope he will be able to follow his dream and study music.  Studying music in Jordan is almost as costly as it is in some countries in Europe. Joker will not be able to pursue his studies unless with financial support from people who are willing to help.  

 

So what if Joker does not complete his education?

I have seen many bright youth in the camp lose hope and with it any aspiration because of poverty. Although I believe Joker has demonstrated strength and perseverance, statistics remain alarming according to a  FAFO survey of Jordan’s Palestinian refugee camps:

Only half of 16 and 17-year olds enrolled in secondary education

Only six per cent of both women and men in the age group 30 to 34 have a university degree

Only 11 per cent of both women and men in the age group 25 to 29 have a university degree

31 per cent are poor in households where the highest level of education attained is secondary schooling

Why Joker?

When I first met Joker, he was the one at most risk among the group of youth we worked with. Most of the others were at school or about to finish high school and enroll in university. He also showed great potential and talent. While there are many Jokers in the camp, with individual efforts we only have the capacity to work with one of them in terms of longer term education. I hope by achieving significant success in this campaign you will be telling me that there is hope we will be able to support more of the Jokers!

(Joker visiting injured Syrian refugee children in Jordan- permission obtained from family of the Syrian child to use the photo) 

Impact

 Pay it forward...

Imagine a world where every young talent enjoys the ability to exercise the right to education without exclusion. While this campaign is not about numbers in terms of impact, but I hope it is seen as a campaign about a life and a small, but important, part of the effort to achieve education for every gifted person deprived of financial means. Joker is the older brother and very committed towards his family and siblings. If you choose to support Joker you will be helping him support his own siblings and their education. 

*Any additional amount that is collected beyond the campaign target will be used to support the education of more gifted males and females from the camp.  


What We Need:

Total Needed:

  • A total of USD41000 will be needed to support Joker attend one additional semester at Brandbjerg (Feb-June. 2016), take language course while sitting for his high school exams (June - Sept. 2016 ), and study his Bachelor in Music (in Jordan or in Europe: starting in September 2016).
  • The campaign aims at raising around USD25000 to support Joker start his university education in hope that later he will be able to support himself or obtain a scholarship 
  • Any amount raised above USD25000 will be used to support creative music students 

Amount is broken down as follows (Amounts in USD)

Brandbjerg Hoskole

     
broken down into:		 6360 plus (Either)
Music Studies in Jordan

     
broken down into:		 29400 (Or)
Music Studies in Europe (namely Germany)**

     broken down into:		 34758
Pocket Money in Denmark  1760 German & English language courses for one year including transportation  0 German & English language courses including transportation  1800
Tuition & Educational Excursion 2700 University Tuition (for four years)* 15000 University Tuition (for four years)*** 4225
Train Ticket (return) 150 Living Expenses & Transportation for 4 years in Jordan 14400 Living expenses for one year in Germany 8451
Ticket & visa 1500 "---" "---" Living expenses for 3 years in Germany (partial)**** 20282
Travel Insurance  250 "---" "---" "---" "---"

If Entire Goal not reached:

  • The collected amount will be spent to support Joker’s education according to the plan, in hope that each step he has achieved will take him one more step further

How you can help

By contributing to this campaign, you help support Joker follow his dream and study music. Joker’s dream will not be realizable without your help.

  • We need a total of 150 people to donate each $100 and convince two friends to donate the same amount  each

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute but believe in Joker’s dream you can help by:

1.  Asking three friends or family members to contribute each $100

2.  Spreading the word by sharing the links for the campaign and its updates with your social networks on Facebook and Twitter every Tuesday and Sat. between 3-5 pm your time. 

3. Finding 10 people to donate USD100 each 

Thank you! 

 


P.S. I understand that you will need to have trust in the campaign in order to support it. For this reason, I am sharing below some information about me and the organization which will be receiving the funds to support Joker.

Who am I?
My name is Rania Sabbah, and I have known Joker for four years since I started working in Talbieh Camp. I am just trying to help in my capacity as an individual because I believe we can all do something to help gifted people who have been failed by life and the education system. If you wish to know more about me, feel free to check my linked-in page at Rania Sabbah's Linked-in Profile Page

Organization Receiving the Funds

IBDAA Association will receive and manage Joker’s education trust. IBDAA  is a nongovernmental non profitable organization that was established in 2008 in Amman, Jordan. Its mission is to adopt and support talented and creative young people whose ages range between 5 to 25. The word IBDAA in Arabic means ‘creativity’.

Some of IBDAA’s activities include:

-  Searching for and identifying gifted youth in less fortunate areas in Jordan and supporting their education or inventions

-  Implementing puppet making and story-telling workshops in Palestinian refugee camps in Jordan with support from the Netherlands embassy in Jordan

-  Promoting gifted youth through facilitating their participation in various conference such as: TEDX Dead Sea conference and New Think Theatre

-  Launching the Arab Creativity Conference

-  Establishing a technology centre in Ein El Basha (an area populated by Palestinian refugees) which supports around 200 students in programming, English language and robotics. The team from the Centre (Baqaa Camp Centre) won the first place in a Lego competition which was held in the United States. Please see Robo IBDAA Team from Baqaa Camp here  here and here

-  Developing the Gaza refugee camp clinic into an e-clinic in cooperation with the United Nations Relief and Work Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA)

Gifted Youth supported by IBDAA:

-  Sima Syrrieh, 18 years old, pianist and music composer. You can listen to music pieces she composed here

-  Master students Ahmad Sharabi and Kamal Hijjawi who are researching the use of Jordanian herbs as a cure for breast cancer

-  Isra Al Assasfeh who is studying medicine and has made a number of theoretical discoveries in pure science. A video of Isra (in Arabic)  here

-  Mohamed Noor Abu Khalif, a 17year old high-school student, who discovered 14 new and unique ways to solve math in easy and fast ways and wrote a book called (Al-Motamayyez in Math). See video (in Arabic) here

-  G-sharp band, also members are students supported by IBDAA. You can meet and listen to them here (in English)

For more information please see IBDAA’s website (in Arabic) at www.ibdaajo.org and Linkedin Page of IBDAA President Maha Darwish,

IBDAA in the Press:

Queen Rania Meets Youth at IBDAA

Robo IBDAA wins Lego Contest

Many many thanks for taking time to read Joker's story and hope you'll believe in his dream and support it!

  Tuition (for four years)***
4225


Train Ticket (return)
150
Living
  Expenses & Transportation for 4 years in Jordan
14400
Living
  expenses for one year in Germany
8451


Ticket & visa
1500

  expenses for 3 years in Germany (partial)****

If Entire
Goal not reached: 

The collected amount will be spent to
     support Joker’s education according to the plan, in hope that each step he
     has achieved will take him one more step further 

How you can help
By contributing to this campaign, you help support
Joker follow his dream and study music. Joker’s dream will not be realizable
without your help.

We need a total of 150 people to
     donate each $100 and convince two friends to donate the same amount  each 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you
cannot contribute but believe in Joker’s dream you can help by: 
1.  Asking three
friends or family members to contribute each $100 
2.  Spreading the
word by sharing
the links for the campaign and its updates with your social networks on
Facebook and Twitter every Tuesday and Sat. between 3-5 pm your time. 3. Finding 10 people to donate USD100 each Thank you!  P.S. I understand that you will need to have trust in the campaign in order to support it. For this reason, I am sharing below some information about me and the organization which will be receiving the funds to support Joker.Who am I?My name is Rania Sabbah, and I have known Joker for four years since I started working in Talbieh Camp. I am just trying to help in my capacity as an individual because I believe we can all do something to help gifted people who have been failed by life and the education system. If you wish to know more about me, feel free to check my linked-in page at Rania
Sabbah's Linked-in Profile Page
Organization Receiving the Funds
IBDAA Association will receive and manage Joker’s education trust. IBDAA
 is a nongovernmental non profitable organization that was established in
2008 in Amman, Jordan. Its mission is to adopt and support talented and
creative young people whose ages range between 5 to 25. The word IBDAA in Arabic means
‘creativity’. 


Some of IBDAA’s activities include: 
- 
Searching for and identifying gifted
youth in less fortunate areas in Jordan and supporting their education or
inventions 
-  Implementing puppet making and story-telling workshops in Palestinian
refugee camps in Jordan with support from the Netherlands embassy in Jordan 
-  Promoting gifted youth through facilitating their participation in
various conference such as: TEDX Dead Sea conference and New Think Theatre
-  Launching the Arab Creativity Conference 
-  Establishing a technology centre in Ein El Basha (an area populated by
Palestinian refugees) which supports around 200 students in programming,
English language and robotics. The team from the Centre (Baqaa Camp Centre) won the first place in
a Lego competition which was held in the United States. Please see Robo IBDAA
Team from Baqaa Camp here  here and here
-  Developing the Gaza refugee camp clinic into an e-clinic in cooperation
with the United Nations Relief and Work Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) 
Gifted Youth supported by IBDAA: 
- 
Sima Syrrieh, 18 years old, pianist and
music composer. You can listen to music pieces she composed here
-  Master students Ahmad Sharabi and Kamal Hijjawi who are researching the
use of Jordanian herbs as a cure for breast cancer 
-  Isra Al Assasfeh who is studying medicine and has made a number of
theoretical discoveries in pure science. A video of Isra (in Arabic)  here
-  Mohamed Noor Abu Khalif, a 17year old high-school
student, who discovered 14 new and unique ways to solve math in easy and fast
ways and wrote a book called (Al-Motamayyez in Math). See video (in
Arabic) here
- 
G-sharp
band, also members are students supported by IBDAA. You can meet and listen to
them here (in
English) 
For more information please see IBDAA’s website (in Arabic) at www.ibdaajo.org and Linkedin Page of IBDAA President
Maha Darwish, 
IBDAA in the Press: 
Queen
Rania Meets Youth at IBDAA
Robo
IBDAA wins Lego Contest
Many many thanks for taking time to read Joker's story and hope you'll believe in his dream and support it!

story:
Short Summary

The Jewish Educational Trade School (JETS) is based in Granada Hills, California,
Founded by Rabbi Mayer Schmukler of Los Angeles  
The JETS Creative Wing aims to help Jewish youth aged 16-20 discover and develop their talents in Music, Cinematography, Photography, Theater, Dance and Art.
This is a first of its kind within the Jewish Educational orthodox world


What We Need & What You Get

We have a music recording studio and a video and photo studio.

Both need serious upgrades to keep up to date with the demand and growth of our current and future students.

We are running now on donated old equipment with limited availability.

With the new equipment we will be able to produce great, regular and Kosher material into the Entertainment Industry 


The Impact

With hundreds of young adults in the Jewish educational system who posses untapped talents, we aim to draw them into our program and help them on their way to a full and successful career in the Jewish Entertainment Industry.

We project a huge growth in the Jewish industry within the next 3 years and now is the prime time for young fresh talent to really learn their trade and play a big part in its growth.


www.JetsSchool.org
