story:
Rural Girls Can Code - Jamaica

Paula Madden – Founder, Rural Girls Code – Jamaica

Paula Madden is a PhD Candidate in Law at Osgoode Hall Law School at York University in the city of Toronto.  She moved to Toronto from rural Jamaica at the age of eleven.  She trained and worked as a Youth Worker in Toronto before embarking on an academic career.  She has developed and managed several programs for children and youth in community-based and non-profits organizations.  She is the author of, African Nova Scotian-Mi’kmaw Relations (Fernwood, 2009).

Why a Commitment to Girls?

Information Communication Technology (ICT) is one of the fastest growing fields in Jamaica and women have been virtually shut out of opportunities to participate.  Girls in Jamaica outperform boys at every level of the school system. Yet boys have more access to the specific courses and training opportunities that allow them entry into the tech field.  Tech careers worldwide have offered significant economic opportunities for those who participate; securing access for girls means that they would have opportunities to build economically independent lives like their male counterparts.

Why an after-school program for rural girls?

Jamaican women and girls have been largely left out of the growing ICT sector in Jamaica.  While there has been a program to improve access, it has happened in the capital city of Kingston over the last two summers with twenty girls participating each year.  Although access is increased by every girl given the opportunity to participate, the numbers remain small and rural girls have thus far been entirely excluded. 

This after-school program represents the 1st of its kind and the only program to specifically target the most disadvantaged girls in the country and it will be the only program sustained year round.

How will your donations be used?

The goal is to raise funds needed to establish a sustainable after-school coding program for girls 7-17 years old in rural Jamaica.  In the first year of the program, we will offer 30 spaces with the goal of developing a non-profit organization to increase the number of girls who access the program each year.

More specifically funds will be used to:

-Purchase hardware: Chromebook computers, iPads

-Software

-Classroom equipment:  chairs, desks, chalkboard, etc.

-Program matériel:  routers, internet access, cabling, etc.

-Stipend for program facilitators

-Transportation for girls to and from the program

-Snacks

-Establish a non-profit charitable organization

Progress to Date

-A newly established agricultural college has committed to providing space for the program

-Program facilitators are being sourced from a local college that offers diplomas and degrees in programming.

-An advisory committee of local volunteers is being organized.

What is being asked of donors?

We need your financial support to help improve the representation of rural Jamaican girls in the growing tech field in the country.  Any donation you make will contribute to the work of making inclusion of Jamaican girls in the field of Information Communication Technology more possible. Every dollar contributed is important, appreciated and moves us closer to the goal of equal access to tech careers for Jamaican girls who will ultimately become the women of Jamaica’s future.

Spread the Word

Please post and re-post the information about the fundraising campaign and program to your networks.

.
story_txt:
Rural Girls Can Code - Jamaica
Paula Madden – Founder, Rural Girls Code – Jamaica
Paula Madden is a PhD Candidate
in Law at Osgoode Hall Law School at York University in the city of
Toronto.  She moved to Toronto from rural
Jamaica at the age of eleven.  She
trained and worked as a Youth Worker in Toronto before embarking on an academic
career.  She has developed and managed
several programs for children and youth in community-based and
non-profits organizations.  She is the author of, African Nova Scotian-Mi’kmaw
Relations (Fernwood, 2009). 
Why a Commitment to Girls?
Information Communication
Technology (ICT) is one of the fastest growing fields in Jamaica and women have
been virtually shut out of opportunities to participate.  Girls in Jamaica outperform boys at every
level of the school system. Yet boys have more access to the specific courses
and training opportunities that allow them entry into the tech field.  Tech careers worldwide have offered
significant economic opportunities for those who participate; securing access
for girls means that they would have opportunities to build economically independent
lives like their male counterparts.
Why an after-school program for rural girls?
Jamaican women and girls have
been largely left out of the growing ICT sector in Jamaica.  While there has been a program to improve
access, it has happened in the capital city of Kingston over the last two
summers with twenty girls participating each year.  Although access is increased by every girl
given the opportunity to participate, the numbers remain small and rural girls
have thus far been entirely excluded.  
This after-school program
represents the 1st of its kind and the only program to specifically
target the most disadvantaged girls in the country and it will be the only
program sustained year round. 
How will your donations be used?
The goal is to raise funds needed
to establish a sustainable after-school coding program for girls 7-17 years old
in rural Jamaica.  In the first year of the
program, we will offer 30 spaces with the goal of developing a non-profit
organization to increase the number of girls who access the program each year.

More specifically funds will be
used to:
-Purchase hardware:
Chromebook computers, iPads 
-Software
-Classroom
equipment:  chairs, desks, chalkboard,
etc.
-Program matériel:  routers, internet access, cabling, etc.
-Stipend for
program facilitators
-Transportation
for girls to and from the program
-Snacks
-Establish a
non-profit charitable organization
Progress to Date
-A newly
established agricultural college has committed to providing space for the
program
-Program
facilitators are being sourced from a local college that offers diplomas and
degrees in programming.
-An advisory
committee of local volunteers is being organized.
What is being asked of donors?
We need your financial support to help improve the representation of rural Jamaican girls in the
growing tech field in the country.  Any
donation you make will contribute to the work of making inclusion of Jamaican
girls in the field of Information Communication Technology more possible. Every dollar contributed is important,
appreciated and moves us closer to the goal of equal access to tech careers for
Jamaican girls who will ultimately become the women of Jamaica’s future. 
Spread the WordPlease post and re-post the information about the fundraising campaign
and program to your networks.
.

story:
About me

Hi everyone! My name is Ania, I'm 20 years old and I am very happy to share with all of you this incredible project in Cusco, Peru. I had never heard of it before I traveled to Cusco three months ago and visited the foundation because a friend  of mine knew about it and took me there. I instantly fell in love and because life is a beautiful thing I ended up working here. I tell you, I had never seen before such an impeccable job regarding  education and health nor such a well organized foundation in Peru. Fundacion Niños del Arco Iris is actually giving a very good life preparation to children and youth in Urubamba who do not have any opportunities and also by providing them with medical care. Everything here WORKS. I  can promise you because I know, that anything you help us with will actually have an impact. When I help, I like to know that it won't be in vain.Trust me, it will not be in vain here. This is the first time we venture the foundation in crowdfunding and we are very excited about it because we know that it is a great opportunity to show our project to the world and make us known.
Help me help this amazing cause to continue changing lives in Urubamba!
Thanks to each one of you,
Ania.

About the foundation

We are Niños del Arco Iris, a foundation located in the Valley of Urubamba, Cusco, Peru. 

Helena van Engelen (Netherlands) arrived to Peru in the year 2001 to realize the sad reality of so many poor families in rural areas of Cusco. There were too many children without any future, so she decided to change that. The first thing she did was adopting seventeen homeless children and provided them with nutrition, health, education, affection and a home. From that moment, she knew that her goal in life was going to be helping as many children as she could and give them the tools to achieve their dreams. Helena sold her house in Holland to buy a 27,000 m2 piece of land in Urubamba and throughout the years, more programs were implemented to the project, in order to reach a greater scope for social development.

Fundacion Niños del Arco Iris provides education and health care through the next social programs: 

1.  Niños del Arco Iris School: 

Its goal is to form real agents of change for social development in Peru through education and values.

·  The children attend school from Monday to Friday (8:00am – 4:30pm).

·  We have 140 deprived students from 1rst grade to 6th grade of primary.

·  They receive a healthy lunch at midday, that helps them fight against anemia and malnutrition.

·   The instilling of values is accomplished through everyday practice, including games and environmental care.

·  From 2:00pm to 4:30pm we have extracurricular activities and workshops such as computer classes, handcrafting, theatre, typical dance classes and music classes.

·  Also, we provide medical and dental care.


2.  CETPRO:

  Provides technical education to deprived youth, so they can get into the labor market with dignified jobs.  

·  It offers two careers which are: Hospitality and Services Management and Computing (I.T.).

·  Each career lasts two years, and they attend classes from Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 1:00pm.

·  The foundation gets them internships in various enterprises and hotels from the area and later, after graduation, they help them find a job.

·  The instilling of values works on CETPRO in the same way as in the school.


3.  Medical Center:

  Accessible health care for the students’ families and other deprived people from the area who need it.

·  We do 40,000 medical assistances each year.

·  People can receive free medical or dental assistance and they pay a minimum symbolic price just for medicines. Patients who can’t even afford to pay the symbolic price are able to pay with their own agricultural products which are used for the children’s lunch in the school.

·  The foundation does several medical campaigns annually, in which the medical team (doctor, dentist and nurse), three CETPRO’s volunteer students and three Foundation’s volunteer employees visit remote highland communities. They stay there for a week and the 100% of the residents receive assistance.

·  These communities do not have any medical access.


Why do we need you?

We have donors in Peru and Holland but we are expanding our boundaries to achieve new goals.  6th grade has been implemented this year (new classroom and 25 more students). On the other hand, we have new CETPRO students and the amount of patients in the Medical Center is growing too. These means that our annual budget increased in USD 20,000. This is a challenge for us but it also demonstrates good quality in what we do. This is why we are asking for your support! We need you in order to keep providing these services to our beneficiaries.

We count on you!



*Las casitas del Arco Iris

We have a hotel inside our Foundation called “Las Casitas del Arco Iris”. This is a project developed to sustain our social programs so all profits go to them. If you want to enjoy a nice stay in the Scared Valley of Urubamba, which is very close to the City of Cusco and near Machu Picchu, while helping children have better lives and get to know more the project, we will be more than happy to receive you! We guarantee you will be happy too. You can book with us here:

http://www.lascasitasdelarcoiris.com
or here:
http://www.booking.com/hotel/pe/las-casitas-del-arco-iris.es.html

story:
¿Por qué pedimos su apoyo?

Las autoridades estatales y de la Universidad de Colima se han aliado para escamotear, desaparecer y desviar recursos que pertenecen a los trabajadores universitarios, recursos que son producto de años de esfuerzo:

  • A la fecha, las autoridades universitarias NO han cumplido sus compromisos ante los trabajadores.
  • El gobierno del estado, encabezado por Mario Anguiano, en contubernio con la Junta Local de Conciliación y Arbitraje, ha pisoteado los derechos, tanto contractuales como humanos, de los trabajadores universitarios, imponiendo junto con las corruptas autoridades universitarias a un líder sindical espurio y afín a sus intenciones perversas de desviar recursos.
  • Con su ayuda, podremos solventar los gastos legales que esta lucha contra la corrupción y el sindicalismo charro ha generado.

Cuánto y el por qué lo necesitamos:

  • Necesitamos 15 mil pesos mensuales ($15,000 MXN) , aproximadamente $800 dólares estadounidenses ($800 USD) exclusivamente para gastos legales. Por más que lo intentemos, nuestros esfuerzos personales no son suficientes. A la fecha, estamos atrasados por más de 6 meses en nuestras pagos por servicios legales.
  • Nos pusimos la meta de $50,000 USD por si acaso no logramos el objetivo, cualquier aportación suya será de gran ayuda para continuar nuestra lucha; por ello, ¡MUCHAS GRACIAS!


¿Por qué aportar?

Su ayuda le permitirá a miles de trabajadores universitarios afectados seguir la lucha por lo que justamente es suyo: recursos para su retiro digno.


Nuestros riesgos

 La persecución de parte de las autoridades universitarias a los trabajadores ha sido constante, sabemos que corremos riesgos pero nonos importa, estamos hartos de la corrupción y la impunidad. Baste un botón de muestra:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QjOMsY0wrA4

Y aquí la muestra de la persecución y acoso de las autoridades universitarias:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mrwx3E-BKIs

     Con su ayuda, podremos librarnos de la persecución y terminar esta historia de atropellos e impunidad en Colima.
      Si usted está de nuestra parte, pero se le imposibilita aportar, le pedimos que corra la voz, nos será de gran ayuda.

story:
Press

I Love Chile http://www.ilovechile.cl/travel-without-tourist-get-indigenous-experience/ 

The Impact

NuMundo will connect thousands of individuals to experiences that will transform their lives.


Within NuMundo lives a deeper learning network, made up of impact centers, which are connecting with each other to exchange best practices, templates and models, engaging in the true sharing economy.


Through the growth of impact centers, thousands of individuals will receive education in regenerative living, while leaving a positive social and economic impact in their local host communities.


Our team recognizes the fundamental issues that are at the root of many social and environmental problems that exist today, such as a lack of awareness and education to our relationship with the planet and our personal power to fulfill a purpose.


We are an awesome dedicated team of skilled changemakers who have abandoned the corporate lifestyle and are living the change we want to see!


Crowdsource!

You can help us in other ways!

  • Join the NuMundo campaign team! Fill out this short form to get involved.
  • Share this campaign through social media posts, email, newsletters, fan pages and groups!
  • Join NuMundo as an ambassador, and build our network by completing quests to earn points that you can redeem for rewards!
  • List an impact center on the network!

story:
WELCOME TO NEW CHALLENGE DISCOVERY!!!


OUR DREAMS

- building libraries

- provide English lessons

- donating schools materials

- teaching the young generation how important the nature is


ABOUT US

Our Aim is to raise funds for local community projects such as providing schooling to children in rural villages, building libraries, provide English lessons and donate school materials to existing schools in the area.

Our future aim is also to reforest the jungle, plant young trees and educate local village people with basic knowledge of how to preserve the forest for future generations


OUR MISSION is to

1. Help develop the education of the children of Bokeo province. Only through education can we ensure that our children have a bright future and make the positive decisions for our community and our planet!

2. Empower rural and indigenious people of this region to restore and protect tropical ecosystems in and around Huay Xai and to reverse the effects of deforestation caused by the actions of irresponsible foreign developers. We want to that our children have a bright future and make the positive decisions for our community and our planet!


COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

We buy books and other learning materials for the children whilst also providing opportunities for our guests to become directly involved by delivering English classes.

We are also working towards projects aimed at empowering rural and indigenous peoples of this region to restore and protect tropical ecosystems in and around Huay Xai and to reverse the effects of deforestation caused by the actions of irresponsible foreign developers.


ESSENTIAL NEEDS

Currently we are using an open bamboo house as classroom. We have some books, pencils and a white board. The students need to sit on the floor as we have a lack of chairs and tables. We therefore want to use the money first for some basic furniture. Then we want to establish a library, so that every child can borrow a book.


FOUNDATION

As we are a small grassroots organization, all of the funds go directly to the projects and nothing is wasted on bureaucracy. Please consider a donation and help us empower and educate the rural people of this beautiful land!


CONTACT

PO Box 298

Ban Houay Xai Neua

Bokeo Province, Laos

+8563 0520 9858

newchallengediscovery@gmail.com

story:
About ReachEquip

ReachEquip’s mission is to bring hope through tackling 5 big global issues: Illiteracy, Illnesses, Poverty, Self-Serving leadership and Spiritual Emptiness.

We believe making a big positive impact in the world does not need to be hard but it can be done while enjoying life to the fullest. We want to engage the young community and those that love sports, arts or music to make a difference in the world. 


Our Goal For This Campaign

By contributing you can make a difference! This year we want to:

• Sponsor 1000 meals to homeless
• Sponsor 5 families for adopting and caring for a child
• Help to plant at least 1 church per year, a church that promotes reconciliation and focuses to help people.

Increase awareness:
• Promote several small organisations that are making a great difference
• Make an encouraging interview with one world famous athlete
• Continue to sponsor several athletes to wear ReachEquip logo in competitions  


Direct your contribution:  We offer you the possibility to direct your donation toward one of our signature issues. Just pick one of the perks from the side and we know that your will is to direct that donation for that specific cause! We will honour your request!!


Team

Our 4 advisory board members come from different countries including USA, Finland and Philippines and have years of experience in starting NPOs, Advertising, Publicity, Governmental work, Church Planting and starting and running companies.
About the Founder   

Mika Ishikawa is an entrepreneur and has so-far founded 4 companies related to computer graphics and 3d animation. One of them is Shaderfarm Co., Ltd. www.shaderfarm.com 

Mika’s career in computer graphics has spanned over 14 years from which most of the years in 3d animation. Mika has worked for projects to companies such as Lexus, Toyota, TATA, Mitsubishi, Honda, Nikon and Panasonic among many others.


Other ways YOU can Help

Help us make this fundraiser a success!

• Please Talk about us to you friends at FB, Twitter, Pinterest…

• Please follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/reachequip

• Please like us on FaceBook: https://www.facebook.com/ReachEquip

• Please Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Help us promote ReachEquip!

• Promote ReachEquip through wearing ReachEquip  (You can download ReachEquip logo for making T-shirts etc from http://reachequip.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/ReachEquip-Logo-Vertical.pdf

Help us identify global and local opportunities to help!

Help us create exciting content for our website!!!

Are you a Filmmaker, Designer, Writer… let us know what you would like to do!

Other ways YOU can HelpHelp us make this fundraiser a success!• Please Talk about us to you friends at FB, Twitter, Pinterest…• Please follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/reachequip• Please like us on FaceBook: https://www.facebook.com/ReachEquip• Please Use the Indiegogo share tools!Help us promote ReachEquip!• Promote ReachEquip through wearing ReachEquip  (You can download ReachEquip logo for making T-shirts etc from http://reachequip.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/ReachEquip-Logo-Vertical.pdfHelp us identify global and local opportunities to
help!Help us create exciting content for our website!!!Are you a Filmmaker, Designer, Writer… let us know what you would like to do!

story:
Overview
Hi everyone! :) I have been given the incredible opportunity to complete a 200-hour Yoga Teacher Training Program from October 2015 - February 2016.  I need to raise $2,800 to cover the tuition costs to make my dream a reality!

Who am I?
My name is Emilie and I am 22 years old. I started practicing yoga shortly after my brother Mike’s unexpected death on August 31, 2013. 

The Earth-shattering grief caused me to question everything about the world- how could something like this ever happen? I felt like I was stuck in a dream I couldn’t wake up from. Being without him couldn’t be the reality I was living. Mike was not only my older brother, but my absolute favorite person in this world- my best friend, and even a father figure as he was 8 years my senior.

I turned to yoga to help me cope with the daily heartache. I first thought of it through more of a fitness perspective- it would keep me busy and help me be active, without being as intense as a P90x class, and the endorphin rush would help naturally elevate my mood. However, the benefits have not only transformed me physically (when I started, I couldn’t even touch my toes!) but have helped change my mind and soul. 

What I’ve learned on the mat has translated to life off the mat. I have become much more patient, grateful, understanding, and kind. I was able to lean on a wonderful community of people with similar thoughts, stories, and backgrounds and truly know compassion, acceptance and love. I know that without yoga I wouldn’t have been able to make it through the loss of my brother- it helped me to truly know who I am, foster a healthy, nonjudgmental environment, and listen to my feelings. I was able to accept that everything does happen for a reason and that I have the inner strength and outside support to get through whatever comes my way.

I want to complete yoga teacher training to not only deepen my practice, but to help others come to the mat and find peace. I want to help others benefit from not only the physical aspects of yoga (it has been known to improve chronic injuries and increase flexibility and endurance, among many other things) but also the mental and emotional benefits that come from dedicating time to yourself on your mat, practicing mindfulness and gratitude, being still, and many other virtues that are hard to truly learn in this crazy, unpredictable world we live in. 

Details
The course calls for both independent and group coursework and covers the following:

Techniques, Training, and Practice
- Meditation
- Asana (posture) and Pranayama (breath)
- Alignment, cueing, and adjustments

Teaching Methodology
- How to theme a class
- The Business of Yoga
- Different styles of yoga- prenatal, kids, vinyasa, etc.

Anatomy and Physiology
- Bones, Muscles, and Connective Tissues and how they relate to postures
- Contraindications to poses and how to work with common injuries safely
- Chakras and the Energy Body

Yoga Philosophy, Lifestyle, and Ethics
- Yoga Sutras
- 8 Limbed Path
- Ethics of Teaching Yoga

Practicum
- Student teaching, observation, and assisting- complete with feedback from students and instructors.  

The program also offers students with unlimited yoga classes during the course to help deepen their practice and assist with their studies.

I have also spoken to the owner of the studio and upon completion of the training program, I will be employed as a yoga teacher and will additionally be trained in pre-natal, post-natal, and kids yoga! So your gift will keep on giving!

Perks
It's so hard to quantify your generosity with gifts, but I tried my best to come up with unique perks that everyone can enjoy. Take this opportunity to improve your wellbeing, or use as a gift for a friend or family member! If nothing suits your fancy, you can still donate without a perk- everyone will still get a personal handwritten thank you note in the mail! Every little bit helps greatly. <3 

What Else Can You Do?
As I am currently struggling financially, I completely understand if you can't afford to give anything right now. Life happens! You can still help (or further help after giving a donation) by please:
-Posting & Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram
-Talking to friends who you think might be interested in helping- e-mail, phone call, -text, etc.
-Reaching out- words of encouragement and love are also very powerful and much -appreciated!

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!
I believe that my journey has come full circle as it will be 2 years since I started that I have the opportunity to complete a yoga teacher training course.
Thank you all so so much for your generosity, love and support. It is never easy to ask for help but I am grateful that I have a beautiful community I can reach out to.

Thank you for helping me fulfill my dream! 
Love and light,
Emilie

story:
We are the Saved By Truth Ministry from Southern California and we are passionate about preaching the Good News about the Kingdom of God and the facts that Jesus is Coming Soon to get his Bride, Very, Very Soon!

My name is Stephen Gregg and have been a disciple of Jesus for 15 years, my wife 19 and our team collectively over 50 years.  We have devoted our lives to the mission of preaching the word to whoever is willing to listen. 

Over the last 5 years, my wife and I have been taught by God revelations and biblical incites that are amazing and life changing.  The Lord has taught us personally so many revelations and things that will impact the entire world in the next coming months and years and very few are talking about it or even know about them.

We will be teaching and showing the world that the Bible does gives us the clues to look for to give us the indication of when Jesus is coming back.  We will clearly show the world how Satan has used the statement that “No man knows the day and the hour” (Matthew 24: 36-37) to deceive the entire Christian world.  This is a Parable from Jesus to his Disciples and Satan has used it to keep the people who love the Lord and are committed to following him, unprepared and not watching so they will become the Unwise Virgins. (Matthew 25: 1)

There is NOTHING more important that committed Christians need to know at this time than this information!

The reason this message is so important to us is that the entire purpose of all of us who are living a Christian life, is to, at some point, be with Jesus and the Father in the Kingdom of God but everyone, including myself, were deceived to think that no one knows when this day will happen. 

We will show with proof from the bible that the bible and Jesus shows his followers by revelation, exactly the signs to look for.

By the time we launch this campaign, within weeks the entire world will know the signs to look for so we can be prepared and not deceived.  We will not give you the exact year, however, the Lord says in his bible, that he will give us the signs to look for and we can tell you, it’s a lot closer than you think, (A Lot Closer).  I know this may be a shock to you but you will see it in your own bible.

The magnitude of this campaign is staggering and worldwide.  It will impact the entire world.  For the followers of Jesus, it is what we have been waiting for our entire Christian walk, to become the Bride of Christ.  For the non-believers, it will be just like in the Days of Noah. Matthew 24: 38-42

The Lord expects us who have been given the gift of knowledge and wisdom to teach it to His people and warn them of what is coming.  We are just obeying his command.

The Lord put this message on our hearts and we will do everything we can to get the Good News of the Kingdom of God preached in every corner of the world. 

We pray you will support this mission.

God Bless You and Yours.

Stephen Gregg
Jamie Gregg
Loretta Haynes
Doris Wood

What We Need & What You Get

We need $68,000 to serve the poor and orphans and marketing materials to help us spread the message worldwide.  There is tragedy going on around the world for Christians and we want to give them hope and a sense of peace in these last days.  We have seen some of the most devestating things with our own eyes and not filtered by the media of what is really going on around the world and we must do our part to help.  Just look at some of the pictures below and you can see that people are in a dire need of assistance just to live a normal life.

We will be using the funds to support different Christian Ministers and churches across the globe who are meeting the needs of the poor.  We are meeting ministers worldwide through our facebook group, https://www.facebook.com/groups/themessiahiscoming/   that have desperate situations in which they need financial support.  We will be providing them with sprirtual and financial assistance.

We will use the money to meet the needs across the world and create the maximum exposure through several of the most popular marketing venues:

  • Give financial aid to 30 + different churches who serve the poor
  • Send clothes and other items needed in the most needed areas
  • Assist with organizations that serve orphans in 3rd world countries
  • Develop and active video and  audio library of bible studies
  • Create printed bible studies for the people who don't have computers
  • YouTube Video Marketing
  • GodTube Video Marketing
  • Facebook – Ad campaigns to promote bible study videos
  • Booking live tradeshows to spread awareness of our organization
  • Appearing as a Radio Talk Show guest to spread the Good News
  • Hosting live speaking events nationwide


    With your donations and the Lord’s help, this mission will create a viral effect and the Lord’s message will be preached around the world by September 2015. The more money we raise, the more people we can reach.

Everyone who contributes will receive a copy of our E-book “Living the Christian Life” Workbook.  Higher contributions will receive different rewards such as copy of all of the published videos on DVD, and recognition on our website. 

The Impact

With your help, we can shed light on a dark world about this most important biblical truth the Lord wants us all to know about, The Day He Is Coming Back.  

The time is near and Jesus is calling for his bride and does not want his true followers to suffer the wrath of God in the Great Tribulation which is coming on the earth.

Your donation will be the most significate donation you can do for the people who hear the message and learn from it.  We can’t express the significance and the amount of impact that your donation can make once this message hits the world but we can say that Jesus said that once the message of the Kingdom of God is preached around the world, He is coming to get his bride.  Matthew 24: 14

We are the messenger, Jesus is the Message!

Your donation can make the world of difference!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the funds to contribute, we understand, your voice can still be heard.  You can help us promote this message to the world for FREE.

  • Pray for the success of this mission and the people who hear the Word of God.
  • Share our links to this campaign on your Facebook page and ask the people you know to help support the mission.
  • Email the link to this campaign to your friend, family and business associate and ask them to support us.
  • Send a testimonial of how Jesus has impacted your life... Tell your story
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on this website to promote the message any way you know how.

We appreciate you and we pray for you, your family and your loved ones.

God bless you all.

The Saved By Truth Ministry


Christian Ministries We Serve

  • Women's Ministry Tea - USA  
  • Prayer House - India
  • House of Comfort Jesus Orphan Home - India 
  • Riagasioka peace, mercy foundation orphanage, church  - Kenya
  • YEESHU DHAM CHURCH - India
  • TGIM Ambassador to Asia - Pakistan
  • Yeeshu Dhaam Trust  - India
  • St. Columban Community - Pakistan

story:
We Love Learning on and off the Water!

We are Educational Tall Ship and we are building futures. We are constructing a sustainable wooden tall ship called Matthew Turner to serve the San Francisco Bay Area. Our mission is to inspire young people to unleash their potential through experiential, environmental education under sail.  The vision is to empower generations of students to become environmental stewards and transform their world through sailing.

Building a tall ship is part of our greater goal of providing experiential learning experiences to youth. Our partner Call of the Sea is currently serving 6,000 students per year on Seaward. Matthew Turner will allow 12,000 additional students per year to experience the powerful on-the-water programs where students experienced and learn seamanship, maritime history, marine ecology, teamwork, leadership and stewardship on day, overnight and ocean expeditions.

                                           

                                   

Students onboard Seaward learn teamwork as they raise the sails

Our brigantine ship is based on master shipbuilder Matthew Turner’s work from the late 19th Century. Turner built 228 ships during 40 years in the Bay Area, his craft were considered the most able and fastest sailing ships in their day. Matthew Turner incorporates old- world technology with 21st century sustainable building and operational technologies, we are designing the vessel to be carbon neutral and reduce the impact on the environment. We are 18 months into our build and we will launch in late 2016, with your help!

                 

School Groups frequently come to the ship to assist with the building and learn about math, engineering, construction and ship building

Donate to Keep Matthew Turner on Course!

Our goal is raise $50,000 through donations. 

Currently we are needing to fund the systems that make the ship go and keep Matthew Turner on course. Funds raised through this campaign will go towards designing and building a rudder and steering system which will cost $50,000.

Please donate at whatever level you are comfortable with giving. While our project will take quite a bit to be fully complete we can achieve milestones with your support. Donate today!

      

                            

The total project cost is estimated at over $6.2 Million, so far we have raised quite a bit in grants and personal funding but we still need to raise $1.5 million more. This campaign to build the steering system is a vital part of the project that we must complete in order to move forward. 

We are a small group of staff, the only paid positions are the Director, Development Assistant and 4 paid builders who all are paid very modestly. Aside from the paid staff we are solely volunteer based and all of our efforts are done with the support and hard work of volunteers who donate their time to make this project come to life.

Should we not reach the full goal the raised funds will be combined with other future funding efforts to complete the goal of $50,000.


Perks of Donating to the Project

Some of our perks for donation include a hat, t- shirt or other gear shown below modeled by world famous models. 

 


At our $100 level, we offer  a set of coasters handmade by our ship builders using our official Matthew Turner  branding stamp and pieces of wood  the ship. We will laminate and send you 5 coasters so you can display your contribution when guests come for drinks.

(A prototype of the coasters that will be sent to you as a perk for a $100 donation)

Some of the perks that are offered for higher donors include invitations to our Annual Donors Dinner, a ride aboard and inaugural sail on Matthew Turner upon completion on the beautiful San Francisco Bay,  and naming rights to planks used onboard the ship. 

Our perks are ways we’d like to say thank you for your donations. We hope that our donors will be able to join us in making this dream of a historic tall ship coming to life right here in the SF Bay and providing lasting educational experiences to youth and adults. 

Our Programs Matter and Have Lasting Impact

More and more, educators are seeking experiential learning opportunities for their students. The Educational Tall Ship will provide the Bay Area with an ideal platform for an adventure in learning. Educational programs are broken out into two areas; those taking place during construction, and aboard Matthew Turner after completion and launch in 2016. We are collaborating with many partners to make our programs rich, inclusive and hands-on. We have hosted school groups from many Bay Area schools , most recently Willow Creek Academy, Petaluma High School and , Bayside Elementary, Rising Stars Program, and The Marin School.

                           

Students learn Marine Science, Bay Ecology and hands on navigation 

Along with specific lessons in seafaring history, navigation, seamanship, marine ecology and science, students also gain teamwork, leadership and communication skills as they take on responsibility for sailing the ship. The construction and operating of a traditional tall ship will spark the inherent love of learning that children of all ages possess, encourage them to see the rich ecological environment and historical relevance of where they live, and to realize their roles as stewards of their world.

                      

Our Volunteers take a break from laying the frames for the deck. 

Additionally, all of our materials, methods and equipment for Matthew Turner are selected with attention to their suitability to design, function and aesthetics, however we also consider the environmental impact of certain materials either in sourcing methods or at the end of use. Our aim is to build a ship that produces zero carbon footprint so we strive to make our building methods reflect our sense of stewardship to our environment. The wood that is used in building Matthew Turner is certified by the Conservation Fund’s Forest Stewardship Certification efforts. The efforts of Forest Stewardship utilize selective logging practices rather than clear cutting as a way to reduce the impact to the source forest ecosystem and to support the fragile complex natural ecosystems. Our power regenerating propulsion systems are another way we are reducing our ecological impact and to promote a sense of stewardship to those students that we serve.

                    

            High School Student Volunteer helps laying the ribs of the ship

Other Ways to Give 

If you are unable to donate funds and you would like to donate in other ways we accept donations in kind for materials (please contact our office for approval) and we also love volunteers to help build the ship. Please contact us and we can arrange for you to volunteer and get to work on building the ship. Please contact Meghan Hartnett, Development Coordinator at meghan@educationaltallship.org.

We would also love for you to share our effort amongst your friends and relatives. We have found that in addition to the desire to donate to our effort, many people are interested in our project for the sake of history or for the educational programs we provide. We would welcome interest from school groups as well who are interested in participating in our educational programs.

Who is Matthew Turner? 

Matthew Turner was a ship builder in the 1800's. He immigrated to the Bay Area from Lake Erie during the Gold Rush. After finding success and deciding to change focus to the production of ship building, to service the Gold Trade. His first vessel was the Nautilus in 1868, which out performed all other ship of the time and raised the bar in sailing ship design. While at the time, the East Coast was converting and producing mostly steam powered vessels, the Western States didn't have as easy access to coal and therefore continued to improve upon wind powered vessels. During his lifetime, Matthew Turner built 228 vessels which contributed to the success of many entrepreneurs of the time including some legacies that sill exist today including Matson Lines, Spreckles Sugar and C&H sugar. 

Who Are We?

The vision behind building Matthew Turner  was developed by Alan Olson with the dream to have a Tall Ship that can be used as the San Francisco Bay's own tall ship bringing children and adults alike to the water and create a connection to maritime history as well as to our natural world. The project got under way in late 2013 and has been steady for the past 18 months. Most recently Educational Tall Ship has merged with Call of the Sea (Executitve Director, Charlie Hart). Call of the Sea specializes in onboard educational programs for kids and adult aboard Seaward. This merger between the two organizations will allow more students to be reached in a more comprehensive way. Our office is staffed by few paid staff including Erika Dwyer, Program Director Call of the Sea and Meghan Hartnett, Development Associate Matthew Turner. Our 4 staff builders direct volunteers who work on building the ship. Our volunteer docents host school groups and work with teachers toe develop lesson plans. Overall we are a fun group of people from all different walks of life, while we take our business seriously, we like to have fun and let loose. Come to one of our events and see our fun side, or volunteer on the ship build and sit and have a beer with us at the end of the day!

                                            Left: Project Director Alan Olson Consults with Head Ship Builder Franz Baichl

Right: Generations come together to learn shipbuilding techniques

    

Above: Lunch times are a nice time to relax and shoot the breeze
story_txt:
We Love Learning on and off the Water!
We are Educational Tall Ship and we are building futures. We are constructing
a sustainable wooden tall ship called Matthew Turner to serve the San Francisco Bay Area. Our mission is
to inspire young people to unleash their potential through experiential,
environmental education under sail.  The vision is to empower generations of students to become
environmental stewards and transform their world through sailing. 
Building a tall ship is part of our greater goal of providing experiential learning experiences to youth. Our partner Call of the Sea is currently serving 6,000 students per year on Seaward. Matthew Turner will allow 12,000 additional students per year to experience the powerful on-the-water programs where students experienced and learn seamanship, maritime history, marine ecology, teamwork, leadership and stewardship on day, overnight and ocean expeditions.                                                                              Students onboard Seaward learn teamwork as they raise the sailsOur brigantine ship is
based on master shipbuilder Matthew Turner’s work from the late 19th Century. Turner
built 228 ships during 40 years in the Bay Area, his craft were considered the
most able and fastest sailing ships in their day. Matthew Turner incorporates old- world technology with 21st century
sustainable building and operational technologies, we are designing the vessel to be carbon neutral and reduce the impact on the environment. We are 18 months into our build and we will launch in late 2016, with your help!
                 School Groups frequently come to the ship to assist with the building and learn about math, engineering, construction and ship building
Donate to Keep Matthew Turner on Course!
Our goal is raise $50,000 through
donations. 
Currently we
are needing to fund the systems that make the ship go and keep Matthew Turner on course. Funds raised through this
campaign will go towards designing and building a rudder and steering system which will cost $50,000. 
Please donate at whatever level you are
comfortable with giving. While our project will take quite a bit to be fully
complete we can achieve milestones with your support. Donate today!                                  The total project cost is estimated at over $6.2 Million, so far we have raised quite a bit in grants and personal funding but we still need to raise $1.5 million more. This campaign to build the steering system is a vital part of the project that we must complete in order to move forward. We are a small group of staff, the only paid positions are the Director, Development Assistant and 4 paid builders who all are paid very modestly. Aside from the paid staff we are solely volunteer based and all of our efforts are done with the support and hard work of volunteers who donate their time to make this project come to life.Should we not reach the full goal the raised funds will be combined with other future funding efforts to complete the goal of $50,000.Perks of Donating to the ProjectSome of our perks for donation include a hat, t- shirt or other gear shown below modeled by world famous models.  At our $100 level, we offer  a set of coasters handmade by our ship builders using our official Matthew Turner  branding stamp and pieces of wood  the ship. We will laminate and send you 5 coasters so you can display your contribution when guests come for drinks. (A prototype of the coasters that will be sent to you as a perk for a $100 donation)Some of the perks that are offered for higher donors include invitations to our Annual Donors Dinner, a ride aboard and inaugural sail on Matthew Turner upon completion on the beautiful San Francisco Bay,  and naming rights to planks used onboard the ship. Our perks are ways we’d like to say thank you for your donations. We hope that our donors will be able to join us in making this dream of a historic tall ship coming to life right here in the SF Bay and providing lasting educational experiences to youth and adults. 
Our Programs Matter and Have Lasting
Impact

More and
more, educators are seeking experiential learning opportunities for their
students. The Educational Tall Ship will provide the Bay Area with an ideal
platform for an adventure in learning. Educational programs are broken out into
two areas; those taking place during construction, and aboard Matthew Turner
after completion and launch in 2016. We are collaborating with many partners to
make our programs rich, inclusive and hands-on. We have hosted school groups from many Bay Area schools , most recently Willow Creek Academy, Petaluma High School and , Bayside Elementary, Rising Stars Program, and The Marin School.                            Students learn Marine Science, Bay Ecology and hands on navigation 
Along with
specific lessons in seafaring history, navigation, seamanship, marine ecology
and science, students also gain teamwork, leadership and communication skills
as they take on responsibility for sailing the ship. The construction and
operating of a traditional tall ship will spark the inherent love of learning
that children of all ages possess, encourage them to see the rich ecological
environment and historical relevance of where they live, and to realize their
roles as stewards of their world.                       Our Volunteers take a break from laying the frames for the deck. 
Additionally,
all of our materials, methods and equipment for Matthew Turner are selected
with attention to their suitability to design, function and aesthetics, however
we also consider the environmental impact of certain materials either in
sourcing methods or at the end of use. Our aim is to build a ship that produces
zero carbon footprint so we strive to make our building methods reflect our
sense of stewardship to our environment. The wood that is used in building Matthew Turner is certified by the Conservation Fund’s Forest Stewardship
Certification efforts. The efforts of Forest Stewardship utilize selective
logging practices rather than clear cutting as a way to reduce the impact to
the source forest ecosystem and to support the fragile complex natural
ecosystems. Our power regenerating propulsion systems are another way we are
reducing our ecological impact and to promote a sense of stewardship to those
students that we serve.                                High School Student Volunteer helps laying the ribs of the ship


Other Ways to Give 
If you are unable to donate funds and you would like to donate in other ways we accept donations in kind for materials (please contact our office for approval) and we also love volunteers to help build the ship. Please contact us and we can arrange for you to volunteer and get to work on building the ship. Please contact Meghan Hartnett, Development Coordinator at meghan@educationaltallship.org.
We would also love for you to share our effort amongst your friends and relatives. We have found that in addition to the desire to donate to our effort, many people are interested in our project for the sake of history or for the educational programs we provide. We would welcome interest from school groups as well who are interested in participating in our educational programs.


Who is Matthew Turner? 
Matthew Turner was a ship builder in the 1800's. He immigrated to the Bay Area from Lake Erie during the Gold Rush. After finding success and deciding to change focus to the production of ship building, to service the Gold Trade. His first vessel was the Nautilus in 1868, which out performed all other ship of the time and raised the bar in sailing ship design. While at the time, the East Coast was converting and producing mostly steam powered vessels, the Western States didn't have as easy access to coal and therefore continued to improve upon wind powered vessels. During his lifetime, Matthew Turner built 228 vessels which contributed to the success of many entrepreneurs of the time including some legacies that sill exist today including Matson Lines, Spreckles Sugar and C&H sugar. Who Are We?The vision behind building Matthew Turner  was developed by Alan Olson with the dream to have a Tall Ship that can be used as the San Francisco Bay's own tall ship bringing children and adults alike to the water and create a connection to maritime history as well as to our natural world. The project got under way in late 2013 and has been steady for the past 18 months. Most recently Educational Tall Ship has merged with Call of the Sea (Executitve Director, Charlie Hart). Call of the Sea specializes in onboard educational programs for kids and adult aboard Seaward. This merger between the two organizations will allow more students to be reached in a more comprehensive way. Our office is staffed by few paid staff including Erika Dwyer, Program Director Call of the Sea and Meghan Hartnett, Development Associate Matthew Turner. Our 4 staff builders direct volunteers who work on building the ship. Our volunteer docents host school groups and work with teachers toe develop lesson plans. Overall we are a fun group of people from all different walks of life, while we take our business seriously, we like to have fun and let loose. Come to one of our events and see our fun side, or volunteer on the ship build and sit and have a beer with us at the end of the day!
                                            Left: Project Director Alan Olson Consults with Head Ship Builder Franz Baichl
Right: Generations come together to learn shipbuilding techniques
     
Above: Lunch times are a nice time to relax and shoot the breeze

story:
UPDATE: Check out this great article written about us!

Hi there. We’re Sidekick Arts, a project developed by members of the Rogers Park Art Alliance in Chicago, IL.  

Our goal is simple: Connect working artists with partner schools to enhance classroom learning and school curriculum with presentations, demonstrations, and workshops.

But we need your help.

Hola. Somos "Sidekick Arts" (Compañero de Artes). Nuestro objetivo es simple: Conectar los artistas con los maestros para ayudar a expandir la educación artística para los estudiantes. Pero necesitamos tu ayuda.

Studies show that students who have access to quality arts education are more academically successful, have increased critical and creative thinking skills, and have higher high school graduation rates. Essentially, the more arts in schools, the better! 

Los estudios muestran que los estudiantes que tienen  acceso a la educación artística de calidad tienen más éxito académico, han aumentado sus habilidades de pensamiento crítico y creativo, y tienen mayores tasas de graduación de la escuela secundaria. En esencia, más cultura en las escuelas, ¡mejor! 

Teachers and administrators know this, but their extremely busy schedules and tight budgets make it challenging to plan additional arts programming.

Los maestros y administradores saben esto, pero sus horarios son extremadamente ocupados y sus presupuestos ajustados hacen que sea difícil para planificar una programación de artes adicional.

On the other hand, there are many local artists who would love to share their craft with schools, but they don't always know how to connect with teachers or how to get fairly compensated for their skills and work within schools.

Por otro lado, hay muchos artistas locales que les encantaría compartir su arte con las escuelas, pero no siempre saben cómo conectarse con los maestros o cómo conseguir una compensación justa por sus habilidades y trabajar dentro de las escuelas.

This leaves both sides feeling isolated when instead, they could be creating rich partnerships with one another.

Esto deja a ambos lados aislados en lugar de crear asociaciones provechosas entre ellos.

That’s where you come in. See, we think the artists and the teachers are the heroes of this story, but every hero needs a good sidekick.

Ahí es donde entras tú. Pensamos que los artistas y los profesores son los héroes de esta historia, pero cada héroe necesita un buen compañero. "Sidekick Arts" (Compañero de Artes) necesita recaudar $8,000 para financiar por completo doce visitas de artistas a través del curso de un año escolar sin costo adicional para las escuelas.

Sidekick Arts needs to raise $8000 to fully fund twelve artist visits over the course of one school year at no extra cost to the schools.

We already have relationships with teachers and artists in several disciplines, like visual art, drama, and music, and we’re working to expand our network. $8000 will allow us to begin accepting applications from artists and connecting those artists with interested teachers.

Ya tenemos relaciones con los maestros y artistas de varias disciplinas, como las artes visuales, el teatro y la música, y estamos trabajando para ampliar nuestra red. $ 8,000 nos permitirá comenzar a aceptar las solicitudes de los artistas y  conectar a los artistas con los profesores interesados.

At Sidekick Arts, we have big dreams and $8,000 is just a beginning. Our goal is to cultivate a stronger community and connection between artists and neighborhood schools; one where students feel inspired, teachers feel supported and artists feel accomplished.

En "Sidekick Arts"( Compañeros de Artes), tenemos grandes sueños y  $8,000 es sólo el comienzo. Nuestro objetivo es cultivar una comunidad y la conexión entre los artistas y escuelas de la vecindad más fuerte; uno donde los estudiantes se sientan inspirados, los maestros se sientan apoyados y los artistas sientan consumados.

But we have to start somewhere. Help us advocate for strong arts programming in schools and invest in a more creative and connected community.

Ayúdanos nosotros abogamos por la programación de artes en las escuelas e invertimos en una comunidad más creativa y conectada.

Our pilot program will begin at Kilmer Elementary and Sullivan High School in Rogers Park, Chicago.  

Thanks for helping, and remember: Every hero needs a good sidekick.

Gracias por ver el video y recuerda: Todo héroe necesita un buen compañero. 

Sidekick Arts is a project developed by the Rogers Park Arts Alliance

"Sidekick Arts" (Compañero de Artes) es un proyecto desarrollado por Rogers PArk Arts Alliance.

Donations are tax deductible through our 501c-3 fiscal sponsor, the Rogers Park Business Alliance.

Las donaciones son deducibles de los impuestos a travéz de nuestro esponsor, Rogers Park Business Alliance.


Can't donate right now? 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about Sidekick Arts!
  • Indiegogo has great share tools for social media
Questions? Contact us! sidekick.chicago@gmail.com

story:
I am sure you have heard of hackathons, and who hasn’t heard the word “Startup”? Well it is time to use ideas like these to give our students a chance to develop the entrepreneurial, technological and artistic skills that they will need to create their own future…

For the first time ever Oakland will be hosting a Youth Startup Weekend in Oakland: A Knight Hack at Castlemont High School, set to take place the weekend of May 29-31, 2015 (see schedule here).This is a unique opportunity for Oakland youth to come together to become producers of technology, not just users, to better their communities and design real change. We are looking for youth and mentors to come together for this weekend of collaboration and innovation. 

Startup Weekend is a global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures. You can view the video above to see how it works. At Castlemont High School, we are using the Startup Weekend format to expose students to an authentic entrepreneurial experience they might not otherwise have. 

But we need your help to do that. We need you to DONATE whatever you can to make this happen!

story:
Our website, Food Under Foot, has been an amazing free resource of information about using wild plants and mushrooms as food and medicine for over 7 years!

An incredible wealth of information, including over 1000 full color photographs, videos, recipes, ebooks, and even a kid's section with cartoon illustrations has been taken down by hackers, who put so many viruses into our pages that it will take hiring professionals and thousands of dollars to fix, or rebuild from scratch.

We considered just walking away, but we love what we are doing: providing free education and resources and empowering people to take control of their food supply. We hope you find this a valuable enough resource to want it restored and rebuilt, and hopefully made even bigger and better than it was.

Was this just the work of a random trouble-maker, or did this happen because we are trouble makers? Learning about wild plants as food and medicine is seen as subversive, even back in 1935 when Gandhi (whose favorite food was reportedly purslane, a prevalent weed) urged his followers to learn about and eat edible weeds  as a way to peacefully but powerfully protest British rule.

YOU can help us restore, rebuild and re-envision Food Under Foot in these three ways:

1. SHARE this campaign with everyone you know, through social media, email, however you can.

2. SIGN UP for our newsletter, which thankfully was separate from our website, and can still get vital information out and keep us in touch. 

3. DONATE whatever you can. Check out our perks and see if there are any that you'd like, or just donate whatever you can, any amount, to show us you care and would like to see Food Under Foot back online.

Thank you!!!

story:
Hi and welcome to Learn+, the social learning platform.

So what do you mean by a social learning platform?

We tried to make learning more like a real school, so we made it a bit like a social network, you can follow people, write posts and share what you are learning and do it live too with others. 

The content is also all user-generated so anyone anywhere can share their knowledge on something they care about. We believe that this will give users a lot of choice and variety.


Okay... So how much will this cost to use?

Nothing, just like most social networks don't charge to create an account, we don't either. Unlike other learning platforms, we feel that by making things free, things are more accessible.

But if everything is free, how do the course makers get rewarded?

We are basing this off YouTube's model. When we feel we have enough active users we will allow course makers to monetize through things like product sponsorships related to their courses and content. 

Surely if anyone can make a course, there will be bad or misleading content!

We will be using active and reactive content management systems to make sure that only valid content gets to you.


Risks and Challenges

There are many risks and challenges with creating a web service but we've been thinking this through for a very long time....

Firstly, production is almost done so it's unlikely we'll have any issues there.

Our main concern is whether enough people will adopt it, we've already been getting course makers interested so we think we will have some content and users ready to go at launch. By bringing course creators with an existing user base to our platform, we will get both users and course creators alike.

story:
N.B. The main text body is in English, but different translations are available below after the English version.

N.B. Il testo qui sotto è in Inglese, altre versioni come quella Italiana iniziano appena sotto alla fine di questo.

Il video con sottotitoli in Italiano si trova a questo link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6QhGNrrqdQ cliccare su "cc" sulla barra in basso se non partono automaticamente.

N.B. El texto principal se encuentra en ingles, pero hay traduccion al español debajo de los textos en italiano e ingles.

-------------------------------------ENGLISH VERSION------------------------------------------


WHO WE ARE?


We are a group of volunteers coming from all over the world to the east Ugandan city of Mbale - each of us on a different path with complimentary life experiences. We are travellers,  explorers of both our outer and inner worlds. We see traveling as a tool to get in touch with other societies and as a chance to develop ourselves internally. In this way it is possible to become, even for a short time, part of that world, letting ourselves be shaped by the experience, by a new reality.

Our personal paths brought us here to Uganda for a volunteering experience, which is a powerful way to be deeply involved in the culture and the society.


OVERVIEW OF OUR VOLUNTEERING


Here in Mbale, a small city that survives mainly though the agricultural industry, we discovered a beautiful and unexpected reality, that deserves to be known, heard and helped.

The project that we are working for is to help and sustain local agricultural development. It has been surprising to find such a high degree of awareness in terms of organic, sustainable agriculture and the deeply ingrained respect for nature. A big contribution to this awareness has come from Slow Food, a non-profit international association which aims to give back value to food, respect the local procedures and the ecosystem, through the sharing and education of local knowledge and traditions. This means organic agriculture. This means respect of our earth and not exploit the soil - the land we live on. And this means respect for the producers. All of this really inspired us, and gave us hope for the future of not only Uganda, but Africa and the world.


OUR PROJECT!!


Our idea is to help a local farmer called Sam, whose farm is central to the "Mugiti" community - located just outside Mbale. This community counts about 2670 members spread in arround 700 households, all of them living through agriculture. They don't have electricity and have a very simple life. Their houses are built with self-made bricks with wooden roof covered with leafs. They take water from a well that has been donated by previous volunteers, and carries it with water cans to the respective areas. Sam utilises his farm as an important example and educational reference for the community and the development of his farming facilities has deeply impacted all of the families in the area.

This is not a conventional farm, focused on a business and a personal income, but a "community farm", a tool at the complete service of the social tissue that lives around it. Sam adheres to the Slow Food philosophy and he deserves assistance to further grow and guide his community, he is creating a better world and his farm could have the ability to act as an example for the greater community and the message will spread.

It is for this reason that we decided to start a crowdfunding project to help grow this community. We are conscious that as volunteers we are often just shooting stars - helping out for small periods of time but barely changing the world. That's why we had the idea of a creating a fund raising project. In this way we would be able to finance some of Sam's projects and the community, giving them the chance to start self-sustaining activities and enable them to take control of their futures. However the impact of this help would go far beyond the money raising - even if this is the main focus. This international help would provide more than a monetary value, it is giving them with the courage to keep going in this positive direction, knowing that they are not alone. We would be building a bridge between our countries and even though it is in a seemingly far away corner of our earth, it is our planet and our role to protect it.


WHAT WILL THE FUND HELP US ACHIEVE?


The projects that you can help make a reality are as follows (in order of priority):


Tools (500 dollars)

The first expense that will be done is the purchase of necessary tools, not only for the projects that are to be started, but also for rutinary farm work. The amount of tools available is not enough as it is, and the constant use of these wears them, making it necessary to discard some or to spend money in repairing.

Allocating 500 dollars (aprox) will provide enough tools not only for the projects that are the aim of this campaign, but also for everyday use of the community.

Tools to be bought are mainly (but not limited to) :


  • Machetes

  • Water cans

  • Wheelbarrows

  • Hoes

  • Shovels



Poultry Shelter (400 dollars)


Benefits


- Organic, self sustaining manure - utilising permaculture techniques, will be used throughout the farm and potentially as a viable means of income due to the high nutritional properties of chicken waste  

- Reduce death of young chickens - provide protection from predators and reduce the risk of death during the rainy season due to drowning

- Constant access to food through the use of troughs will promote faster, healthier growth

- Increase in reproduction efficiency and monitoring

- Source of food and income for the community



Bee Hive (100 dollars)


Benefits


- Promote a healthier environment through increased pollination which leads to empowering the fertility of the area as in the permaculture rules.

- Great means of income, of which can be reinvested into the community to develop other projects including the construction of a fishing farm

-  Medicinal purposes

- Sugar replacement - increase the self sustainability of the farm by reducing the need to source sugar from outside the community

- The low maintenance of the beehives will allow farmers to work on other products / harvesting…


ABOUT DONATIONS

The idea is to donate an amount between the one suggested by us and linked to a Perk. However is possible to donate a free amount without receiving the Perk. To do this is enough to choose “No Perks, I just want to donate” at the moment of the donation, so to write the preferred amount without any Perk.

If you instead choose to receive the Perk you will be asked you address so to be shipped directly at your place.

Once chosen the amount/Perk you will be directed in the payment page, where you can choose between paypal or credit card.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US!

We understand very well that not everybody can afford a donation.

No worries!! You can still help us out a lot!!

By spreading the message to everybody you know  if you think this project deserve it, and also using the social networks like Facebook, Twitter, Google+ ecc..

THANK YOUUUUUU!!!!!


----------------------------------ITALIAN VERSION-----------------------------------------------


CHI SIAMO?


Siamo un gruppo di volontari di diverse nazionalità che si sono incontrati qui in Uganda a Mbale, cittadina a est non lontana dal Kenya, ognuno giunto qui dal proprio percorso ed esperienze di vita. Siamo viaggiatori, esploratori di mondi fuori e dentro di noi. Vediamo il viaggio come potente strumento per entrare in profondo contatto con altre società, culture e come un occasione per un profondo lavoro interiore. Vissuto in questo modo è possibile, seppur per un breve peridodo, diventare parter di quel mondo, fondersi e lasciarsi plasmare dall'esperienza, dalla nuova realtà.

I nostri percorsi personali ci hanno portato qui in Uganda per un esperienza di volontariato il quale è sempre un modo potente di farsi coinvolgere nella cultura e nella società.


LA NOSTRA ESPERIENZA DI VOLONTARIATO


Qui a Mbale, una piccola cittadina che vive principalmente attorno all'agricoltura locale, abbiamo scoperto una bellissima e inaspettata realtà, che merita di essere conosciuta, ascoltata e aiutata.

Il progetto per il quale stiamo lavorando è l'aiutare e dare supporto allo sviluppo dell'agricoltura locale. Ci ha stupito molto trovare qui un così alto grado di coscienza riguardo l'agricoltura biologica e sostenibile e un profondo rispetto per l'ecosistema. Un gran contributo per questa consapevolezza arriva dal movimento dello slow food, "un associazione internazionale non-profit impegnata a ridare valore al cibo, nel rispetto di chi lo produce, in armonia con ambiente ed ecosistemi, grazie ai saperi di cui sono custodi territori e tradizioni locali".

Ciò significa agricoltura biologica. Ciò significa rispetto per il pianeta e non sfruttamento incosciente del terreno, della terra su cui viviamo. E certamente significa rispetto per chi produce. Tutto questo ci ha davvero ispirato e dato grande speranza per il futuro, non solo di questo paese, ma dell'Africa e del mondo.


IL NOSTRO PROGETTO!!


Il nostro contributo in particolare va a Sam, un agricoltore locale, la quale fattoria è centrale della comunità "Mugiti" appena fuori dal centro di Mbale. Questa comunità conta circa 2670 membri distrubuiti in oltre 700 famiglie, che ruotano tutte attorno all'agricoltura. Non hanno corrente elettrica e vivono una vita semplicissima. Le loro case sono fatte di mattoni auto-prodotti e hanno tetti in legno coperti di foglie. Prendono l'acqua da un pozzo che è stato donato di recente da altri volontari e la trasportano alle loro case con delle taniche.

Qui Sam con la sua fattoria è un importante riferimento per tutta la comunità, e le sue strutture e progetti hanno forte impatto per tutte le famiglie della zona. Questa non è una fattoria convenzionale focalizzata sui profitti e il benessere di un singolo, ma bensì uno strumento al servizio della comunità che gli ruota attorno. Anche Sam aderisce ai concetti della Slow Food e merita d

avvero il nostro sostegno per guidare e sviluppare la sua comunità. Sta contribuendo ad un mondo migliore e la sua fattoria potrebbe diventare un buon esempio da seguire per membri di altre comunità.

Siamo tuttavia coscienti che noi come volontari siamo spesso come delle meteore, che passano per un breve periodo, partecipano ai progetti e danno una mano, ma non lasciano mai il segno contribuendo ad un cambio concreto. Abbiamo quindi pensato di organizzare una raccolta fondi per finanziare dei progetti che li possano mettere in condizioni di auto sufficienza. Qui va precisata una cosa molto importante. Una raccolta fondi per loro non significherebbe soltanto denaro per finanziare le iniziative, seppur sia il focus principale. Vorrebbe dire molto di più. Siginificherebbe dare visibilità a questa comunità, dare coraggio e una spinta verso la direzione virtuosa che hanno intrapreso facendo sapere loro che non solo soli ma hanno il supporto e l'ammirazione di molte persone. Questa iniziativa è alla fine un collegamento, un ponte che gettiamo tra i nostri paesi e questa realtà poco conosciuta ma meritevole, e che seppur distante da noi ha a che fare con la terra madre, col nostro pianeta e con l'impegno a rispettarlo e custodirlo.


COME IMPIEGHEREMO I FONDI RICEVUTI?


Il progetti che potremmo avviare con il vostro aiuto sono i seguenti (in ordine di priorità)


Attrezzi e strumenti (500 dollari)


I primi fondi verrebbero usati per l'acquisto di strumenti e attrezzi fondamentali, non solo per i progetti in fase di avvio, ma anche per i lavori di agricoltura quotidiani. Il numero attuale di attrezzature non è sufficiente e le poche presenti sono sottoposte ad un super lavoro rendendo necessarie riparazioni di fortuna e spese extra.

Partendo da 500 dollari potremmo rendere disponibili sufficienti strumenti per i progetti di cui si propone la campagna, come anche per l'uso quotidiano e futuro della comunità.

Gli attrezzi da acquistare sarebbero principalmente (ma non solo limitati a questi)


  • Maceti

  • Taniche d'acqua

  • Carriole

  • Zappe

  • Badili



Pollaio (400 dollari)


Benefici


- Produzione di concime organico auto sostenibilie - usando tecniche della permacultura verrebbe usato per accelerare la produzione di hummus naturale - con la possibilità di produrre un entrata tramite la vendita di tale concime.

- Ridurre il tasso di morte di polli giovani, fornire protezione da potenziali predatori e ridurre il rischio di morte per annegamento durante la stagione delle piogge.

- Costante accesso al cibo grazie a mangiatoie promuoverebbe una crescita più rapida e sana

- Aumento delle riproduzioni e possibilità di monitoraggio delle stesse

- Fonte di cibo ed entrate economiche per la comunità


Apicoltura (100 dollari)


Benefici


- Promuovere la salute dell'ambiente grazie all'aumentata impollinazione e come da permacultura un potenzialmento della fertilità dell'area.

- Ottima fonte di entrate, le quali verrebbero reinvestite dalla comunità per altri progetti tra i quali la costruzione di una "fattoria di pesca"

-  Scopi medicinali

- Sostituzione dello zucchero - aumento della sostenibilità della fattoria riducendo la dipendenza dallo zucchero esterno alla comunità

- La poca necessità di lavoro e manutenzione permetterebbe ai fattori di dedicarsi ad altri prodotti e/o alla raccolta.


PERKS/RICONOSCIMENTI


Oltre a immaginare il gran beneficio che porterebbero le vostre donazioni abbiamo ovviamente anche dei pensierini pronti per voi!!

Questi sono i "perks" che vedete al lato in inglese, purtroppo li non c'è abbastanza spazio per tradurli in Italiano, li riportiamo quindi tradotti qui sotto:


$5

Faraja (Incoraggiamento)

GRAZIE!! Ogni piccolo passo è di grande aiuto, e grandi risultati partono dal basso. Troverai il tuo nome negli updeate della campagna e nei social networks.


$10

Kuongeza (Spinta)

Grazie per la spinta!! Tanti "Digital Thanks!!" urlati nei social networks e naturalmente troverai il tuo nome nella lista delle donazioni negli update della pagina.


$25

Msaada (Supporto)


Ti siamo molto grati per il tuo supporto!! Meriti qualcosa di unico!! Ti invieremo un "Thank you" video girato nel villaggio con i membri della comunità!! E naturalmente troverai il tuo nome negli update e nei social media!


$50

Msukumo (Motivazione)

Wow!! Ci motivi davvero ad andare avanti, e per questo vogliamo ringraziarti con una bellissima cartolina dall'Africa assieme al "thank you" video e l'urlo digitale sui social network!!


$100

Ichochezi (Incitamento)

Le cose si fanno serie, e vogliamo tanto ringraziarti a nome della comunità!! Per il tuo aiuto speciale ti meriti una confezione del famoso Caffè bio dell'Uganda, preso direttamente dalle produzioni locali. E naturalmente i riconoscimenti precedenti..

$200

Ujasiri (Coraggio)

Siamo SENZA PAROLE!! Ti senti davvero coinvolto, e per ringraziarti della tua partecipazione riceverai 2 piccoli stupendi pezzi di artigianato locale, e inoltre una confezione del famoso Caffè bio dell'Uganda preso direttamente dalle produzioni locali, e naturalmente tutti i riconoscimenti precedenti.


$300 USD

Utetezi (Sponsorizzazione)

SEI DAVVERO GRANDE!!! Non sappiamo davvero che dire, ma ciò che è certo è che riceverai uno stupendo pezzo di artigianato locale così da avere sempre con te un pezzetto di Africa. Ti invieremo inoltre 2 piccoli manufatti, una confezione del famoso Caffè bio dell'Uganda preso direttamente dai produttori locali, inoltre come sopra il "Thank you" video, e il tuo nome apparirà nella pagina principale della raccolta e nei social networks.


NOTE SULLE DONAZIONI


L'idea base è di donare una cifra tra quelle suggerite da noi e associate ad un Perk ovvero un riconoscimento. E' tuttavia possibile donare una cifra libera e non ricevere il Perk, e per fare questo basta scegliere al momento della donazione “No Perks, I just want to donate - No perks, voglio solo dare il mio contributo” così da poter scegliere la cifra desiderata senza ricevere il riconoscimento/perk.

Se sceglierete di ricevere il perk, vi verrà richiesto l'indirizzo per poterlo spedire direttamente a casa vostra.

Scelta la cifra e l'eventuale perk, vi troverete nella pagina di selezione del pagamento. Potrete scegliere tra carta di credito/debito o Paypal.

Per ragioni di comodità con la valuta abbiamo scelto il Dollaro Americano.

Il cambio attuale Euro Dollaro al 6 Ottobre è:

Perk da...Equivale a...
