€ 300  € 267,69

NON PUOI O NON TE LA SENTI DI FARE UNA DONAZIONE?


Siamo consci che non tutti si possono permettere una donazione monetaria..

Nessun problema, Potete esserci di grande aiuto lo stesso!!

Spargendo il più possibile la parola ad amici e conoscenti su questo progetto se lo credete valido, e utilizzando anche i vari social networks come Facebook, Twitter, Google+ ed altri…


Grazieeeee!!!



................................................... VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL..................................................


Quienes somos?


Somos un grupo de voluntarios que vienen desde todas partes del mundo a la ciudad del este de Uganda llamada Mbale, cada uno de nosotros en un camino distinto con experiencias de vida complementarias. Somos viajeros, exploradores del mundo. Vemos el viajar como una herramientas para ponernos en contacto con otras sociedades y como una oportunidad para desarrollarnos internamente. De esta forma es posible convertirse, por lo menos temporalmente, en parte del mundo, permitiendo que seamos marcados por la experiencia, por una nueva realidad.


Nuestros caminos personales nos trajeron hasta Uganda para una oportunidad de voluntariado, la cual es una forma poderosa de estar profundamente involucrado en la cultura y la sociedad.



Resumen de nuestra experiencia


Aquí en Mbale, una pequeña ciudad que sobrevive principalmente a través de la agricultura industrial, encontramos una bella e inesperada realidad que merece ser dada a conocer, ser escuchada y apoyada.

El proyecto para el cual trabajamos se basa en ayudar el desarrollo sostenible de la agricultura local. Ha sido sorprendente encontrar tan alto grado de conciencia en términos de agricultura orgánica y sostenible y el respeto por la naturaleza tan profundamente asimilado. Una gran contribución hacia esta conciencia viene de ¨Slow Food¨, una asociación internacional sin ánimo de lucro la cual busca devolver valor a la comida, respeto por los procedimientos locales y el ecosistema, compartiendo y educando respecto a las tradiciones y el conocimiento local. Esto es agricultura organica. Esto es respeto por la tierra y la no explotación del suelo en que vivimos.

Esto además significa respeto por los granjeros. Todo esto nos inspiró, y nos dio esperanza para el futuro no solo de Uganda, sino de África y el mundo.


Nuestro proyecto!!


La idea es ayudar a un granjero local llamado Sam, su granja es central para la comunidad ¨Mugiti¨ - ubicada justo afuera de Mbale. Esta comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente 700 hogares, todos viviendo a través de la agricultura. Ellos no cuentan con electricidad y tienen un estilo de vida muy simple. Sus casas son construidas con ladrillos manufacturados localmente, con techos en madera cubiertos con hojas. Ellos toman agua de pozos de agua donados previamente por otros voluntarios, y la llevan de vuelta a casa con contenedores.

La granja de Sam es utilizada como un importante ejemplo y referencia educacional para la comunidad, todos los desarrollos observados en esta granja han tenido un fuerte impacto en todas las familias del área.

Esta no es una granja convencional enfocada en los negocios y ganancias personales, es una ¨granja comunitaria¨, una herramienta para el servicio de las personas que viven alrededor.

Sam se adhiere a la filosofia de Slow Food, y merece apoyo para hacer crecer y guiar a su comunidad, él está creando un mundo mejor y su granja puede actuar como ejemplo para toda el área, permitiendo que el mensaje se difunda.


Es por esta razón que decidimos empezar un proyecto de recaudación para ayudar a crecer la comunidad. Somos conscientes que como voluntarios a veces no tenemos el impacto deseado, ayudando por una pequeña cantidad de tiempo pero teniendo poco impacto a largo plazo. Al decidir crear una recaudación de fondos podremos ayudar a financiar los proyectos de Sam y a la comunidad en general, dándoles la capacidad de iniciar actividades sostenibles y a tomar control de su futuro.

Sin embargo, el impacto de esta ayuda lograría mucho más que la simple recaudación de fondos - aun teniendo en cuenta que este es el principal objetivo. Esta ayuda internacional provee más que un valor monetario, les está dando el coraje para continuar en esta positiva direccion, conociendo que no están solos. Estaríamos construyendo un puente entre nuestras naciones y a pesar de estar en esquinas opuestas de La Tierra, es nuestro planeta y nuestra responsabilidad es protegerlo.




Qué lograremos con los fondos?


Los proyectos que puedes ayudar a hacer realidad son los siguientes (en orden de prioridad):




Compra de herramientas (500 dolares)


El primer gasto que se hará es la compra de herramientas necesarias, no solo para los proyectos que están por empezar, sino tambien para trabajos rutinarios de granja. La cantidad de herramientas disponible no es suficiente en estos momentos, y el uso constante las desgasta, haciendo que sea necesario descartar algunas o gastar dinero en reparaciones.

Separando 500 dolares (aproximadamente) se proveerán suficientes herramientas no solo para los proyectos que busca impulsar esta campaña, sino para el uso diario de la comunidad.

Las herramientas que se compraran son: (pero no limitadas a)


  • Machetes

  • Recipientes de agua

  • Carretillas

  • Picas

  • Palas





Gallinero (400 dolares), 3 en total

Beneficios:


  • Estiércol orgánico y auto sostenible - utilizando técnicas de permacultura, este sera usado a travez de la granja y potencialmente será viable como un medio para generar dinero, esto debido a las altas propiedades nutricionales de los desechos de gallina.

  • Reducir el número de muertes de gallinas jóvenes, al proveer protección contra depredadores y al reducir el riesgo de muerte durante temporada de lluvias, debido a ahogamiento.

  • Accesso costante a comida por medio del uso de recipientes alimentadores, esto promoverá un crecimiento más rápido y saludable.

  • Incremento en la eficiencia de reproducción y de monitoreo.

  • Fuente de alimento y de dinero para la comunidad.






Enjambre de abejas (100 dolares) 3 en total


Beneficios:


  • Promover un medio ambiente más saludable a través de la polinización incrementada, lo cual lleva a mejorar la fertilidad del área, según las reglas de la permacultura.

  • Un excelente medio para generar dinero, el cual puede ser reinvertido en la comunidad para desarrollar otros proyectos, incluyendo la construcción de un estanque para peces.

  • Propositos medicinales.

  • Reemplazo para el azúcar, incremento en la autosostenibilidad de la granja al reducir la necesidad de obtener azúcar por fuera de la comunidad.

  • El bajo costo de mantenimiento de los enjambres de abeja permitirá a los granjeros trabajar en otros productos.



Acerca de las donaciones



La idea es donar un valor según los valores sugeridos conectados con un regalo. Sin embargo es posible donar un valor libre sin recibir el regalo. Para hacer esto solo debes seleccionar la opción ¨sin regalo, solo quiero donar¨ al momento de completar la donación, para escoger entonces el valor preferido sin recibir regalo.

Si en vez de eso prefieres recibir el regalo, se te pedirá tu direccion para poder enviar el regalo directamente a tu hogar.

Una vez escojas el valor, se te llevará a la pagina de pago, donde puedes escoger entre paypal o tarjeta de crédito.



Donaciones:

(tasa de conversión de Octubre 9 - 2015)


Faraja (estimulo)

 $5 dolares - $ 14.470 pesos colombianos

Gracias! Cada pequeño paso ayuda mucho, y los grandes objetivos empiezan desde abajo. Escribiremos tu nombre en las actualizaciones de indiegogo y en redes sociales.


Kuongeza (impulso)

$10 dolares - $ 28.940 pesos colombianos

Gracias por la ayuda!! Muchas ¨gracias digitales¨ para ti. Serás mencionado/a en nuestras redes sociales y por supuesto, tu nombre estara en la lista de donadores publicada en las actualizaciones y en las redes sociales.


Msaada (apoyo)

$25 dolares - $ 72.350 pesos colombianos

Estamos profundamente agradecidos por tu apoyo. Mereces algo único!! Te enviaremos un vídeo de agradecimiento hecho en la aldea junto a los miembros de la comunidad!! Y por supuesto encontrarás tu nombre en redes sociales y actualizaciones!


Msukumo (inspiración)

$50 dolares - $ 144.701 pesos colombianos

Wow!! Realmente nos inspiras para seguir luchando, queremos agradecerte con una hermosa y única tarjeta postal de Africa, además de un video de agradecimiento y un reconocimiento en redes sociales.


Ichochezi (incitación)

$100 dolares - $ 289.402 pesos colombianos

Las cosas se están poniendo serias, y de corazón queremos agradecerte en nombre de la comunidad!! Por tu ayuda especial mereces una bolsa del mundialmente reconocido café de Uganda, obtenida directamente de los granjeros locales. Y como es de esperarse, todos los premios previamente mencionados.


Ujasiri (fortaleza)

$200 dolares - $ 578.804 pesos colombianos

Realmente estamos SIN PALABRAS!! Estas muy interesado/a en esto, y para agradecerte recibirás 2 pequeñas artesanías locales, además de eso una bolsa del mundialmente respetado café de Uganda, obtenida directamente de los granjeros, y todos los regalos ya mencionados.


Utetezi (defensa y apoyo)

$300 dolares - $ 868.206 pesos colombianos

ERES INCREIBLE!! Sencillamente no sabemos qué decir o como agradecerte, pero por supuesto recibirás una artesanía local grande, para que puedas tener una pequeña parte de África. También te enviaremos 2 artesanías pequeñas, una bolsa del mundialmente reconocido café de Uganda, obtenida directamente de los granjeros locales. Y todos los premios previamente mencionados.



Otras formas en que puedes ayudarnos!


Entendemos muy bien que no todos pueden pagar una donación.No te preocupes!! Aun asi puedes ayudarnos mucho!!Al compartir el mensaje a través de redes sociales como facebook, google+, twitter, y demás.


MUCHAS GRACIASSS!!!
story_txt:
N.B. The main text body is in English, but different translations are available below after the English version.N.B. Il testo qui sotto è in Inglese, altre versioni come quella Italiana iniziano appena sotto alla fine di questo.Il video con sottotitoli in Italiano si trova a questo link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6QhGNrrqdQ cliccare su "cc" sulla barra in basso se non partono automaticamente.N.B. El texto principal se encuentra en ingles, pero hay traduccion al español debajo de los textos en italiano e ingles.-------------------------------------ENGLISH VERSION------------------------------------------WHO WE ARE?We are a group of volunteers coming from all over the world to the east Ugandan city of Mbale - each of us on a different path with complimentary life experiences. We are travellers,  explorers of both our outer and inner worlds. We see traveling as a tool to get in touch with other societies and as a chance to develop ourselves internally. In this way it is possible to become, even for a short time, part of that world, letting ourselves be shaped by the experience, by a new reality. Our personal paths brought us here to Uganda for a volunteering experience, which is a powerful way to be deeply involved in the culture and the society. OVERVIEW OF OUR VOLUNTEERINGHere in Mbale, a small city that survives mainly though the agricultural industry, we discovered a beautiful and unexpected reality, that deserves to be known, heard and helped.The project that we are working for is to help and sustain local agricultural development. It has been surprising to find such a high degree of awareness in terms of organic, sustainable agriculture and the deeply ingrained respect for nature. A big contribution to this awareness has come from Slow Food, a non-profit international association which aims to give back value to food, respect the local procedures and the ecosystem, through the sharing and education of local knowledge and traditions. This means organic agriculture. This means respect of our earth and not exploit the soil - the land we live on. And this means respect for the producers. All of this really inspired us, and gave us hope for the future of not only Uganda, but Africa and the world.OUR PROJECT!!Our idea is to help a local farmer called Sam, whose farm is central to the "Mugiti" community - located just outside Mbale. This community counts about 2670 members spread in arround 700 households, all of them living through agriculture. They don't have electricity and have a very simple life. Their houses are built with self-made bricks with wooden roof covered with leafs. They take water from a well that has been donated by previous volunteers, and carries it with water cans to the respective areas. Sam utilises his farm as an important example and educational reference for the community and the development of his farming facilities has deeply impacted all of the families in the area.This is not a conventional farm, focused on a business and a personal income, but a "community farm", a tool at the complete service of the social tissue that lives around it. Sam adheres to the Slow Food philosophy and he deserves assistance to further grow and guide his community, he is creating a better world and his farm could have the ability to act as an example for the greater community and the message will spread.It is for this reason that we decided to start a crowdfunding project to help grow this community. We are conscious that as volunteers we are often just shooting stars - helping out for small periods of time but barely changing the world. That's why we had the idea of a creating a fund raising project. In this way we would be able to finance some of Sam's projects and the community, giving them the chance to start self-sustaining activities and enable them to take control of their futures. However the impact of this help would go far beyond the money raising - even if this is the main focus. This international help would provide more than a monetary value, it is giving them with the courage to keep going in this positive direction, knowing that they are not alone. We would be building a bridge between our countries and even though it is in a seemingly far away corner of our earth, it is our planet and our role to protect it.WHAT WILL THE FUND HELP US ACHIEVE?The projects that you can help make a reality are as follows (in order of priority):Tools (500 dollars)The first expense that will be done is the purchase of necessary tools, not only for the projects that are to be started, but also for rutinary farm work. The amount of tools available is not enough as it is, and the constant use of these wears them, making it necessary to discard some or to spend money in repairing.Allocating 500 dollars (aprox) will provide enough tools not only for the projects that are the aim of this campaign, but also for everyday use of the community.Tools to be bought are mainly (but not limited to) :
Machetes
Water cans
Wheelbarrows
Hoes
Shovels
Poultry Shelter (400 dollars)Benefits- Organic, self sustaining manure - utilising permaculture techniques, will be used throughout the farm and potentially as a viable means of income due to the high nutritional properties of chicken waste  - Reduce death of young chickens - provide protection from predators and reduce the risk of death during the rainy season due to drowning- Constant access to food through the use of troughs will promote faster, healthier growth- Increase in reproduction efficiency and monitoring- Source of food and income for the communityBee Hive (100 dollars)Benefits- Promote a healthier environment through increased pollination which leads to empowering the fertility of the area as in the permaculture rules.- Great means of income, of which can be reinvested into the community to develop other projects including the construction of a fishing farm-  Medicinal purposes- Sugar replacement - increase the self sustainability of the farm by reducing the need to source sugar from outside the community- The low maintenance of the beehives will allow farmers to work on other products / harvesting…ABOUT DONATIONSThe idea is to donate an amount between the one suggested by us and linked to a Perk. However is possible to donate a free amount without receiving the Perk. To do this is enough to choose “No Perks, I just want to donate” at the moment of the donation, so to write the preferred amount without any Perk.If you instead choose to receive the Perk you will be asked you address so to be shipped directly at your place.Once chosen the amount/Perk you will be directed in the payment page, where you can choose between paypal or credit card.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US!We understand very well that not everybody can afford a donation.No worries!! You can still help us out a lot!!By spreading the message to everybody you know  if you think this project deserve it, and also using the social networks like Facebook, Twitter, Google+ ecc..THANK YOUUUUUU!!!!!----------------------------------ITALIAN VERSION-----------------------------------------------CHI SIAMO?Siamo un gruppo di volontari di diverse nazionalità che si sono incontrati qui in Uganda a Mbale, cittadina a est non lontana dal Kenya, ognuno giunto qui dal proprio percorso ed esperienze di vita. Siamo viaggiatori, esploratori di mondi fuori e dentro di noi. Vediamo il viaggio come potente strumento per entrare in profondo contatto con altre società, culture e come un occasione per un profondo lavoro interiore. Vissuto in questo modo è possibile, seppur per un breve peridodo, diventare parter di quel mondo, fondersi e lasciarsi plasmare dall'esperienza, dalla nuova realtà. I nostri percorsi personali ci hanno portato qui in Uganda per un esperienza di volontariato il quale è sempre un modo potente di farsi coinvolgere nella cultura e nella società. LA NOSTRA ESPERIENZA DI VOLONTARIATOQui a Mbale, una piccola cittadina che vive principalmente attorno all'agricoltura locale, abbiamo scoperto una bellissima e inaspettata realtà, che merita di essere conosciuta, ascoltata e aiutata.Il progetto per il quale stiamo lavorando è l'aiutare e dare supporto allo sviluppo dell'agricoltura locale. Ci ha stupito molto trovare qui un così alto grado di coscienza riguardo l'agricoltura biologica e sostenibile e un profondo rispetto per l'ecosistema. Un gran contributo per questa consapevolezza arriva dal movimento dello slow food, "un associazione internazionale non-profit impegnata a ridare valore al cibo, nel rispetto di chi lo produce, in armonia con ambiente ed ecosistemi, grazie ai saperi di cui sono custodi territori e tradizioni locali".Ciò significa agricoltura biologica. Ciò significa rispetto per il pianeta e non sfruttamento incosciente del terreno, della terra su cui viviamo. E certamente significa rispetto per chi produce. Tutto questo ci ha davvero ispirato e dato grande speranza per il futuro, non solo di questo paese, ma dell'Africa e del mondo. IL NOSTRO PROGETTO!!Il nostro contributo in particolare va a Sam, un agricoltore locale, la quale fattoria è centrale della comunità "Mugiti" appena fuori dal centro di Mbale. Questa comunità conta circa 2670 membri distrubuiti in oltre 700 famiglie, che ruotano tutte attorno all'agricoltura. Non hanno corrente elettrica e vivono una vita semplicissima. Le loro case sono fatte di mattoni auto-prodotti e hanno tetti in legno coperti di foglie. Prendono l'acqua da un pozzo che è stato donato di recente da altri volontari e la trasportano alle loro case con delle taniche.Qui Sam con la sua fattoria è un importante riferimento per tutta la comunità, e le sue strutture e progetti hanno forte impatto per tutte le famiglie della zona. Questa non è una fattoria convenzionale focalizzata sui profitti e il benessere di un singolo, ma bensì uno strumento al servizio della comunità che gli ruota attorno. Anche Sam aderisce ai concetti della Slow Food e merita davvero il nostro sostegno per guidare e sviluppare la sua comunità. Sta contribuendo ad un mondo migliore e la sua fattoria potrebbe diventare un buon esempio da seguire per membri di altre comunità.Siamo tuttavia coscienti che noi come volontari siamo spesso come delle meteore, che passano per un breve periodo, partecipano ai progetti e danno una mano, ma non lasciano mai il segno contribuendo ad un cambio concreto. Abbiamo quindi pensato di organizzare una raccolta fondi per finanziare dei progetti che li possano mettere in condizioni di auto sufficienza. Qui va precisata una cosa molto importante. Una raccolta fondi per loro non significherebbe soltanto denaro per finanziare le iniziative, seppur sia il focus principale. Vorrebbe dire molto di più. Siginificherebbe dare visibilità a questa comunità, dare coraggio e una spinta verso la direzione virtuosa che hanno intrapreso facendo sapere loro che non solo soli ma hanno il supporto e l'ammirazione di molte persone. Questa iniziativa è alla fine un collegamento, un ponte che gettiamo tra i nostri paesi e questa realtà poco conosciuta ma meritevole, e che seppur distante da noi ha a che fare con la terra madre, col nostro pianeta e con l'impegno a rispettarlo e custodirlo.COME IMPIEGHEREMO I FONDI RICEVUTI?Il progetti che potremmo avviare con il vostro aiuto sono i seguenti (in ordine di priorità)Attrezzi e strumenti (500 dollari)I primi fondi verrebbero usati per l'acquisto di strumenti e attrezzi fondamentali, non solo per i progetti in fase di avvio, ma anche per i lavori di agricoltura quotidiani. Il numero attuale di attrezzature non è sufficiente e le poche presenti sono sottoposte ad un super lavoro rendendo necessarie riparazioni di fortuna e spese extra.Partendo da 500 dollari potremmo rendere disponibili sufficienti strumenti per i progetti di cui si propone la campagna, come anche per l'uso quotidiano e futuro della comunità.Gli attrezzi da acquistare sarebbero principalmente (ma non solo limitati a questi)
Maceti
Taniche d'acqua
Carriole
Zappe
Badili
Pollaio (400 dollari)Benefici- Produzione di concime organico auto sostenibilie - usando tecniche della permacultura verrebbe usato per accelerare la produzione di hummus naturale - con la possibilità di produrre un entrata tramite la vendita di tale concime. - Ridurre il tasso di morte di polli giovani, fornire protezione da potenziali predatori e ridurre il rischio di morte per annegamento durante la stagione delle piogge.- Costante accesso al cibo grazie a mangiatoie promuoverebbe una crescita più rapida e sana - Aumento delle riproduzioni e possibilità di monitoraggio delle stesse- Fonte di cibo ed entrate economiche per la comunitàApicoltura (100 dollari)Benefici- Promuovere la salute dell'ambiente grazie all'aumentata impollinazione e come da permacultura un potenzialmento della fertilità dell'area.- Ottima fonte di entrate, le quali verrebbero reinvestite dalla comunità per altri progetti tra i quali la costruzione di una "fattoria di pesca"-  Scopi medicinali- Sostituzione dello zucchero - aumento della sostenibilità della fattoria riducendo la dipendenza dallo zucchero esterno alla comunità- La poca necessità di lavoro e manutenzione permetterebbe ai fattori di dedicarsi ad altri prodotti e/o alla raccolta.PERKS/RICONOSCIMENTIOltre a immaginare il gran beneficio che porterebbero le vostre donazioni abbiamo ovviamente anche dei pensierini pronti per voi!!Questi sono i "perks" che vedete al lato in inglese, purtroppo li non c'è abbastanza spazio per tradurli in Italiano, li riportiamo quindi tradotti qui sotto:$5Faraja (Incoraggiamento)GRAZIE!! Ogni piccolo passo è di grande aiuto, e grandi risultati partono dal basso. Troverai il tuo nome negli updeate della campagna e nei social networks.$10Kuongeza (Spinta)Grazie per la spinta!! Tanti "Digital Thanks!!" urlati nei social networks e naturalmente troverai il tuo nome nella lista delle donazioni negli update della pagina.$25Msaada (Supporto)Ti siamo molto grati per il tuo supporto!! Meriti qualcosa di unico!! Ti invieremo un "Thank you" video girato nel villaggio con i membri della comunità!! E naturalmente troverai il tuo nome negli update e nei social media!$50Msukumo (Motivazione)Wow!! Ci motivi davvero ad andare avanti, e per questo vogliamo ringraziarti con una bellissima cartolina dall'Africa assieme al "thank you" video e l'urlo digitale sui social network!!$100Ichochezi (Incitamento)Le cose si fanno serie, e vogliamo tanto ringraziarti a nome della comunità!! Per il tuo aiuto speciale ti meriti una confezione del famoso Caffè bio dell'Uganda, preso direttamente dalle produzioni locali. E naturalmente i riconoscimenti precedenti..$200Ujasiri (Coraggio)Siamo SENZA PAROLE!! Ti senti davvero coinvolto, e per ringraziarti della tua partecipazione riceverai 2 piccoli stupendi pezzi di artigianato locale, e inoltre una confezione del famoso Caffè bio dell'Uganda preso direttamente dalle produzioni locali, e naturalmente tutti i riconoscimenti precedenti.$300 USDUtetezi (Sponsorizzazione)SEI DAVVERO GRANDE!!! Non sappiamo davvero che dire, ma ciò che è certo è che riceverai uno stupendo pezzo di artigianato locale così da avere sempre con te un pezzetto di Africa. Ti invieremo inoltre 2 piccoli manufatti, una confezione del famoso Caffè bio dell'Uganda preso direttamente dai produttori locali, inoltre come sopra il "Thank you" video, e il tuo nome apparirà nella pagina principale della raccolta e nei social networks.NOTE SULLE DONAZIONIL'idea base è di donare una cifra tra quelle suggerite da noi e associate ad un Perk ovvero un riconoscimento. E' tuttavia possibile donare una cifra libera e non ricevere il Perk, e per fare questo basta scegliere al momento della donazione “No Perks, I just want to donate - No perks, voglio solo dare il mio contributo” così da poter scegliere la cifra desiderata senza ricevere il riconoscimento/perk.Se sceglierete di ricevere il perk, vi verrà richiesto l'indirizzo per poterlo spedire direttamente a casa vostra.Scelta la cifra e l'eventuale perk, vi troverete nella pagina di selezione del pagamento. Potrete scegliere tra carta di credito/debito o Paypal.Per ragioni di comodità con la valuta abbiamo scelto il Dollaro Americano.Il cambio attuale Euro Dollaro al 6 Ottobre è:Perk da...Equivale a...$ 5  € 4,46$ 10  € 8,92$ 25  € 22,30$ 50  € 44,60$ 100  € 89,23$ 200  € 178,46€ 300  € 267,69NON PUOI O NON TE LA SENTI DI FARE UNA DONAZIONE?Siamo consci che non tutti si possono permettere una donazione monetaria..Nessun problema, Potete esserci di grande aiuto lo stesso!!Spargendo il più possibile la parola ad amici e conoscenti su questo progetto se lo credete valido, e utilizzando anche i vari social networks come Facebook, Twitter, Google+ ed altri…Grazieeeee!!!................................................... VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL..................................................Quienes somos?Somos un grupo de voluntarios que vienen desde todas partes del mundo a la ciudad del este de Uganda llamada Mbale, cada uno de nosotros en un camino distinto con experiencias de vida complementarias. Somos viajeros, exploradores del mundo. Vemos el viajar como una herramientas para ponernos en contacto con otras sociedades y como una oportunidad para desarrollarnos internamente. De esta forma es posible convertirse, por lo menos temporalmente, en parte del mundo, permitiendo que seamos marcados por la experiencia, por una nueva realidad.Nuestros caminos personales nos trajeron hasta Uganda para una oportunidad de voluntariado, la cual es una forma poderosa de estar profundamente involucrado en la cultura y la sociedad.Resumen de nuestra experienciaAquí en Mbale, una pequeña ciudad que sobrevive principalmente a través de la agricultura industrial, encontramos una bella e inesperada realidad que merece ser dada a conocer, ser escuchada y apoyada.El proyecto para el cual trabajamos se basa en ayudar el desarrollo sostenible de la agricultura local. Ha sido sorprendente encontrar tan alto grado de conciencia en términos de agricultura orgánica y sostenible y el respeto por la naturaleza tan profundamente asimilado. Una gran contribución hacia esta conciencia viene de ¨Slow Food¨, una asociación internacional sin ánimo de lucro la cual busca devolver valor a la comida, respeto por los procedimientos locales y el ecosistema, compartiendo y educando respecto a las tradiciones y el conocimiento local. Esto es agricultura organica. Esto es respeto por la tierra y la no explotación del suelo en que vivimos.Esto además significa respeto por los granjeros. Todo esto nos inspiró, y nos dio esperanza para el futuro no solo de Uganda, sino de África y el mundo.Nuestro proyecto!!La idea es ayudar a un granjero local llamado Sam, su granja es central para la comunidad ¨Mugiti¨ - ubicada justo afuera de Mbale. Esta comunidad cuenta con aproximadamente 700 hogares, todos viviendo a través de la agricultura. Ellos no cuentan con electricidad y tienen un estilo de vida muy simple. Sus casas son construidas con ladrillos manufacturados localmente, con techos en madera cubiertos con hojas. Ellos toman agua de pozos de agua donados previamente por otros voluntarios, y la llevan de vuelta a casa con contenedores. La granja de Sam es utilizada como un importante ejemplo y referencia educacional para la comunidad, todos los desarrollos observados en esta granja han tenido un fuerte impacto en todas las familias del área.Esta no es una granja convencional enfocada en los negocios y ganancias personales, es una ¨granja comunitaria¨, una herramienta para el servicio de las personas que viven alrededor.Sam se adhiere a la filosofia de Slow Food, y merece apoyo para hacer crecer y guiar a su comunidad, él está creando un mundo mejor y su granja puede actuar como ejemplo para toda el área, permitiendo que el mensaje se difunda.Es por esta razón que decidimos empezar un proyecto de recaudación para ayudar a crecer la comunidad. Somos conscientes que como voluntarios a veces no tenemos el impacto deseado, ayudando por una pequeña cantidad de tiempo pero teniendo poco impacto a largo plazo. Al decidir crear una recaudación de fondos podremos ayudar a financiar los proyectos de Sam y a la comunidad en general, dándoles la capacidad de iniciar actividades sostenibles y a tomar control de su futuro. Sin embargo, el impacto de esta ayuda lograría mucho más que la simple recaudación de fondos - aun teniendo en cuenta que este es el principal objetivo. Esta ayuda internacional provee más que un valor monetario, les está dando el coraje para continuar en esta positiva direccion, conociendo que no están solos. Estaríamos construyendo un puente entre nuestras naciones y a pesar de estar en esquinas opuestas de La Tierra, es nuestro planeta y nuestra responsabilidad es protegerlo.Qué lograremos con los fondos?Los proyectos que puedes ayudar a hacer realidad son los siguientes (en orden de prioridad):Compra de herramientas (500 dolares)El primer gasto que se hará es la compra de herramientas necesarias, no solo para los proyectos que están por empezar, sino tambien para trabajos rutinarios de granja. La cantidad de herramientas disponible no es suficiente en estos momentos, y el uso constante las desgasta, haciendo que sea necesario descartar algunas o gastar dinero en reparaciones.Separando 500 dolares (aproximadamente) se proveerán suficientes herramientas no solo para los proyectos que busca impulsar esta campaña, sino para el uso diario de la comunidad.Las herramientas que se compraran son: (pero no limitadas a)
Machetes
Recipientes de agua
Carretillas
Picas
Palas
Gallinero (400 dolares), 3 en totalBeneficios:
Estiércol orgánico y auto sostenible - utilizando técnicas de permacultura, este sera usado a travez de la granja y potencialmente será viable como un medio para generar dinero, esto debido a las altas propiedades nutricionales de los desechos de gallina.
Reducir el número de muertes de gallinas jóvenes, al proveer protección contra depredadores y al reducir el riesgo de muerte durante temporada de lluvias, debido a ahogamiento.
Accesso costante a comida por medio del uso de recipientes alimentadores, esto promoverá un crecimiento más rápido y saludable.
Incremento en la eficiencia de reproducción y de monitoreo.
Fuente de alimento y de dinero para la comunidad.
Enjambre de abejas (100 dolares) 3 en totalBeneficios:
Promover un medio ambiente más saludable a través de la polinización incrementada, lo cual lleva a mejorar la fertilidad del área, según las reglas de la permacultura.
Un excelente medio para generar dinero, el cual puede ser reinvertido en la comunidad para desarrollar otros proyectos, incluyendo la construcción de un estanque para peces.
Propositos medicinales.
Reemplazo para el azúcar, incremento en la autosostenibilidad de la granja al reducir la necesidad de obtener azúcar por fuera de la comunidad.
El bajo costo de mantenimiento de los enjambres de abeja permitirá a los granjeros trabajar en otros productos.
Acerca de las donacionesLa idea es donar un valor según los valores sugeridos conectados con un regalo. Sin embargo es posible donar un valor libre sin recibir el regalo. Para hacer esto solo debes seleccionar la opción ¨sin regalo, solo quiero donar¨ al momento de completar la donación, para escoger entonces el valor preferido sin recibir regalo.Si en vez de eso prefieres recibir el regalo, se te pedirá tu direccion para poder enviar el regalo directamente a tu hogar.Una vez escojas el valor, se te llevará a la pagina de pago, donde puedes escoger entre paypal o tarjeta de crédito.Donaciones:(tasa de conversión de Octubre 9 - 2015)Faraja (estimulo) $5 dolares - $ 14.470 pesos colombianosGracias! Cada pequeño paso ayuda mucho, y los grandes objetivos empiezan desde abajo. Escribiremos tu nombre en las actualizaciones de indiegogo y en redes sociales.Kuongeza (impulso)$10 dolares - $ 28.940 pesos colombianosGracias por la ayuda!! Muchas ¨gracias digitales¨ para ti. Serás mencionado/a en nuestras redes sociales y por supuesto, tu nombre estara en la lista de donadores publicada en las actualizaciones y en las redes sociales.Msaada (apoyo)$25 dolares - $ 72.350 pesos colombianosEstamos profundamente agradecidos por tu apoyo. Mereces algo único!! Te enviaremos un vídeo de agradecimiento hecho en la aldea junto a los miembros de la comunidad!! Y por supuesto encontrarás tu nombre en redes sociales y actualizaciones!Msukumo (inspiración)$50 dolares - $ 144.701 pesos colombianosWow!! Realmente nos inspiras para seguir luchando, queremos agradecerte con una hermosa y única tarjeta postal de Africa, además de un video de agradecimiento y un reconocimiento en redes sociales.Ichochezi (incitación)$100 dolares - $ 289.402 pesos colombianosLas cosas se están poniendo serias, y de corazón queremos agradecerte en nombre de la comunidad!! Por tu ayuda especial mereces una bolsa del mundialmente reconocido café de Uganda, obtenida directamente de los granjeros locales. Y como es de esperarse, todos los premios previamente mencionados.Ujasiri (fortaleza)$200 dolares - $ 578.804 pesos colombianosRealmente estamos SIN PALABRAS!! Estas muy interesado/a en esto, y para agradecerte recibirás 2 pequeñas artesanías locales, además de eso una bolsa del mundialmente respetado café de Uganda, obtenida directamente de los granjeros, y todos los regalos ya mencionados.Utetezi (defensa y apoyo)$300 dolares - $ 868.206 pesos colombianosERES INCREIBLE!! Sencillamente no sabemos qué decir o como agradecerte, pero por supuesto recibirás una artesanía local grande, para que puedas tener una pequeña parte de África. También te enviaremos 2 artesanías pequeñas, una bolsa del mundialmente reconocido café de Uganda, obtenida directamente de los granjeros locales. Y todos los premios previamente mencionados.Otras formas en que puedes ayudarnos!Entendemos muy bien que no todos pueden pagar una donación.No te preocupes!! Aun asi puedes ayudarnos mucho!!Al compartir el mensaje a través de redes sociales como facebook, google+, twitter, y demás.MUCHAS GRACIASSS!!!

story:
My name is Christopher LeBlanc. I am a 19 year old aspiring actor based in Ottawa, Canada. I have a dream of becoming a successful, working actor. I have been pursuing this dream for the past 3 years now. It all started when I was in the eighth grade, and a teacher of mine at the time told me that I had a talent for acting. She was my drama teacher, and she saw potential in me. At the time, I didn't want to act, I just wanted to be in the class and have fun. She even offered to write me a letter of recommendation for Canterbury high school (which was the high school of artistically talented students). I naively rejected, because I wanted to go to a school that all my friends were going to, and where I thought it would be easier for me to have a social life. In high school, that teacher and her suggestion ran through my mind every day. I often wondered had I made the right decision, maybe she was right and knew me better than I knew myself. I took drama every year in high school because of that teacher. I thoroughly enjoyed drama class, it was a place where I experienced freedom and really the only class that I was 110% engaged in. I didn't know what it was about the class, I just loved it. I got really involved with sports teams, I didn't have a favourite sport so I tried out for all the major sports (i.e Basketball, Football, Track & Field and Rugby). I liked playing the sports but I thoroughly enjoyed and loved the performance part of the game. I loved being seen by all the parents and fans. I loved the entertainment that we were providing for the audience. That's where my heart was, it was in the performance. So, I stayed involved in the sports and drama class. When I was 16, I decided that I was going to become an actor because I loved performing and I wanted to live a life that I loved and that I could be happy in. So, I got an agent and began auditioning for roles. I auditioned for many things, and was fortunate enough to land a few small print ads, for LCBO, Maynards and Slidestand. I was in a play in my senior year of high school, and a buddy of mine and I won a Cappie award for best ensemble in a play for out performance.  I auditioned for the last 3 years and paid for acting workshops before paying for a private acting coach, whom I've benefitted a great deal from working with. A friend of mine suggested that I should contact an agency in Toronto. I did and when I got there, the agent I met with said that I had a great deal of potential and he would like for me to be a part of his roster, but he would love it if I went the American Academy of Dramatic Arts to train first. I told him I couldn't afford it, my family couldn't afford it, there was no way I could go to that school. He told me then, that I should start with a smaller agency, because he only works with established actors. I tried to convince him to take a chance on me, but business is business and he needs me to go to the school or nothing can happen. I went home, a little bummed but not the slightest bit discouraged. I looked up the Academy on the web, and it seemed like an incredible opportunity for any aspiring actor to have that kind of foundation in their performance. It gave them a competitive edge that was incomparable to what any private acting coach could offer. I thought it was worth a shot, to at least apply for it.  So, I applied for the school and sent in all the necessary documentation (i.e transcript, letters of recommendation, etc.). Everything was good, so I had an audition set up for the Academy. My audition went so well, that I got accepted earlier than I thought and I was offered a $12 thousand dollar scholarship to go to the academy. I have money saved up, however, it is not enough to cover tuition as well as the cost of living in LA. 


What I need is $15 thousand USD to pay for the cost of living there. As well as to add on to the money I have saved and am taking from the bank in order to pay for the tuition. I will become successful, because I believe that I am the one. I will become successful, because I am confident, motivated and tenacious. I will out work all my fellow students at the academy, because I need this more than they do. I want to prove to myself and everyone else that you can achieve your dream, that you can do whatever it is that you want to do. I will achieve my goal because I want to motivate others to do the same. I want to inspire greatness in other people. I want to go into high schools and middle schools after my success and show them that if I can do it, you can do it too. You just have to believe and make the effort. It's not easy trying to be successful. But, I think it would be harder to be laying on my death bed and standing around me are the ghosts of the ideas and dreams that were given to me, saying why didn't you try. Why did you let your family talk you out of it. Why didn't you try to find the money for the academy other ways. Why did you give up? Why didn't you try to be all that you can be? That my friends will be much harder to deal with than anything that could be thrown my way on my journey to success. I will become successful, because I want to inspire the world with my success to achieve their own goals and dreams. When you're chasing your dream there is fire that burns inside you that makes you find the joy in life. It puts a smile on your face because everyday when you wake up and go after your dream, you just get this overwhelming sensation that life is beautiful and you're so excited to just be alive. I want to bring that joy of life to the earth, I want to bring happiness into peoples lives, I want to connect with people and I believe the best way to do that is through accomplishing my goals and dreams. I need your help to do this, I need that money to pay for school. I swear to you that it will not be for nothing. The money is going towards my education. I will be the next big thing, because my "why" is you. All of you! I'm doing this to better all our lives, and with that weighing on my shoulders, there is no chance that I'll give up. Anything is possible with motivation, confidence and tenacity. We will impact the world, because you believe in me, and I only want to serve the world with my talent.

I don't believe that there is any risk here. I ran the 400m sprint, when I competed in track and field. I learned a valuable lesson when I was training and competing. The lesson was that if you really want to become better at something, running faster in the 400m for instance, you just have to remember that you want that and every time that you train, you train your hardest. I dropped from 58seconds in the 400m to 50 secs in just 5 months.  I didn't want to always lose, so my technique got better, I developed efficiency in running, through focus and motivation. I say I don't believe there is any risk here, because I honestly will train at the academy the same way that I trained for the 400m, harder even, because this is my passion. This is what I want to do with the rest of my life. I don't care how long it takes or how much it cost, I have to do this, no matter what happens. It's my time, I was born for a purpose and that purpose is to achieve my goal and then motivate everyone else do achieve theirs. Imagine what the world would be life if everyone lived their dream. How incredible would our society be? How happy would everyone be? I just want to change the world, no big deal. But, I need your help to do so, please consider me. I will not disappoint. 

Please share this with Indiegogo share tools, to all friends and family members, any little bit helps. Thank you so very much.
story_txt:
My name is Christopher LeBlanc. I am a 19 year old aspiring actor based in Ottawa, Canada. I have a dream of becoming a successful, working actor. I have been pursuing this dream for the past 3 years now. It all started when I was in the eighth grade, and a teacher of mine at the time told me that I had a talent for acting. She was my drama teacher, and she saw potential in me. At the time, I didn't want to act, I just wanted to be in the class and have fun. She even offered to write me a letter of recommendation for Canterbury high school (which was the high school of artistically talented students). I naively rejected, because I wanted to go to a school that all my friends were going to, and where I thought it would be easier for me to have a social life. In high school, that teacher and her suggestion ran through my mind every day. I often wondered had I made the right decision, maybe she was right and knew me better than I knew myself. I took drama every year in high school because of that teacher. I thoroughly enjoyed drama class, it was a place where I experienced freedom and really the only class that I was 110% engaged in. I didn't know what it was about the class, I just loved it. I got really involved with sports teams, I didn't have a favourite sport so I tried out for all the major sports (i.e Basketball, Football, Track & Field and Rugby). I liked playing the sports but I thoroughly enjoyed and loved the performance part of the game. I loved being seen by all the parents and fans. I loved the entertainment that we were providing for the audience. That's where my heart was, it was in the performance. So, I stayed involved in the sports and drama class. When I was 16, I decided that I was going to become an actor because I loved performing and I wanted to live a life that I loved and that I could be happy in. So, I got an agent and began auditioning for roles. I auditioned for many things, and was fortunate enough to land a few small print ads, for LCBO, Maynards and Slidestand. I was in a play in my senior year of high school, and a buddy of mine and I won a Cappie award for best ensemble in a play for out performance.  I auditioned for the last 3 years and paid for acting workshops before paying for a private acting coach, whom I've benefitted a great deal from working with. A friend of mine suggested that I should contact an agency in Toronto. I did and when I got there, the agent I met with said that I had a great deal of potential and he would like for me to be a part of his roster, but he would love it if I went the American Academy of Dramatic Arts to train first. I told him I couldn't afford it, my family couldn't afford it, there was no way I could go to that school. He told me then, that I should start with a smaller agency, because he only works with established actors. I tried to convince him to take a chance on me, but business is business and he needs me to go to the school or nothing can happen. I went home, a little bummed but not the slightest bit discouraged. I looked up the Academy on the web, and it seemed like an incredible opportunity for any aspiring actor to have that kind of foundation in their performance. It gave them a competitive edge that was incomparable to what any private acting coach could offer. I thought it was worth a shot, to at least apply for it.  So, I applied for the school and sent in all the necessary documentation (i.e transcript, letters of recommendation, etc.). Everything was good, so I had an audition set up for the Academy. My audition went so well, that I got accepted earlier than I thought and I was offered a $12 thousand dollar scholarship to go to the academy. I have money saved up, however, it is not enough to cover tuition as well as the cost of living in LA. 
   
What I need is $15 thousand USD to pay for the cost of living there. As well as to add on to the money I have saved and am taking from the bank in order to pay for the tuition. I will become successful, because I believe that I am the one. I will become successful, because I am confident, motivated and tenacious. I will out work all my fellow students at the academy, because I need this more than they do. I want to prove to myself and everyone else that you can achieve your dream, that you can do whatever it is that you want to do. I will achieve my goal because I want to motivate others to do the same. I want to inspire greatness in other people. I want to go into high schools and middle schools after my success and show them that if I can do it, you can do it too. You just have to believe and make the effort. It's not easy trying to be successful. But, I think it would be harder to be laying on my death bed and standing around me are the ghosts of the ideas and dreams that were given to me, saying why didn't you try. Why did you let your family talk you out of it. Why didn't you try to find the money for the academy other ways. Why did you give up? Why didn't you try to be all that you can be? That my friends will be much harder to deal with than anything that could be thrown my way on my journey to success. I will become successful, because I want to inspire the world with my success to achieve their own goals and dreams. When you're chasing your dream there is fire that burns inside you that makes you find the joy in life. It puts a smile on your face because everyday when you wake up and go after your dream, you just get this overwhelming sensation that life is beautiful and you're so excited to just be alive. I want to bring that joy of life to the earth, I want to bring happiness into peoples lives, I want to connect with people and I believe the best way to do that is through accomplishing my goals and dreams. I need your help to do this, I need that money to pay for school. I swear to you that it will not be for nothing. The money is going towards my education. I will be the next big thing, because my "why" is you. All of you! I'm doing this to better all our lives, and with that weighing on my shoulders, there is no chance that I'll give up. Anything is possible with motivation, confidence and tenacity. We will impact the world, because you believe in me, and I only want to serve the world with my talent.I don't believe that there is any risk here. I ran the 400m sprint, when I competed in track and field. I learned a valuable lesson when I was training and competing. The lesson was that if you really want to become better at something, running faster in the 400m for instance, you just have to remember that you want that and every time that you train, you train your hardest. I dropped from 58seconds in the 400m to 50 secs in just 5 months.  I didn't want to always lose, so my technique got better, I developed efficiency in running, through focus and motivation. I say I don't believe there is any risk here, because I honestly will train at the academy the same way that I trained for the 400m, harder even, because this is my passion. This is what I want to do with the rest of my life. I don't care how long it takes or how much it cost, I have to do this, no matter what happens. It's my time, I was born for a purpose and that purpose is to achieve my goal and then motivate everyone else do achieve theirs. Imagine what the world would be life if everyone lived their dream. How incredible would our society be? How happy would everyone be? I just want to change the world, no big deal. But, I need your help to do so, please consider me. I will not disappoint. Please share this with Indiegogo share tools, to all friends and family members, any little bit helps. Thank you so very much.

story:
Students of Changarawe Secondary School constantly face the trouble of warding off sexual predators while walking miles to school. They also face the trouble of getting clean water & having a safe place to lay their heads.

The girls are the most vulnerable group as they are more susceptible to physical, verbal and sexual violence. Many girls of Changarawe Secondary School in Mafinga-Tanzania have already been victims of sexual abuse and have become pregnant or HIV positive and therefore unable to continue with their education. A major contributing factor to this horrid circumstance is the lack of a community school bus. The majority of the students live a minimum of 7 to 10 kilometers from the school, with some having even greater distances to travel. No child deserves to feel insecure or be mistreated.

Thamani Ya Mwanamke/Value of a Woman(TYM) is a registered non-profit organization that aims at helping to eliminate the struggles faced in a society. The students of Changarawe Secondary School face many obstacles that hinder making a good education possible. Your donations will help to turn student's wishes into reality and will bring Mafinga children one-step closer to experiencing a secure and joyful education. 

Campaign Goals:

* The project will cost over 130, 000 but our organization wish to fund-raise approximately $95,000 to get kick start with the construction of three dormitories, two for the girls and one for the boys and a well. The dormitories will house a minimum of 400 girls and 250 boys. The Budget for the dormitories is $90,000 while that for the well is $5,000.

*The a well will supply clean water to the school.  The organization will also encourage the people of Changarawe, Mafinga to use the wells to irrigate their crops and produce surplus food to donate to school and to sale in the local markets so as to generate income, creating a means of sustaining the new resources.

The impact of your support will be huge in providing the students with a safe living area and clean water- basic necessities that every person should have. We appreciate any contribution you can make. 


Challenges

The biggest challenge our organization face is the funds for construction materials and labor. Mafinga community leaders agreed to the urgent need for dormitories at Changarawe school and will help with mobilization of community members to help with the constructions to minimize the cost.

Why this project matters?

Many organizations have high overhead cost that can prevent donations from reaching those in need; your support:

  •  will improve student study time
  • will enable student to help each other through study groups therefore improve their academic status 
  • student will ensure the safety of students and students will be well monitored
  •  Students' health will improve as the students will have proper meals, good sleep and clean water for domestic use 
  • student will be protected from harsh weather to which they do not have appropriate gears such as jackets for cold and rain seasons, rain boots, backpacks to protects their school materials e.t.c
  • students will be protected from children labor abuse and  other violence/abuse      
 TYM board members will be present on the site and will work hand -in- hand with students, school staff and community member from start to finish of the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

The organization is seeking for volunteers to help with the construction of dormitories project.  Volunteers can also help in varied areas including; teaching, counseling, workshops on HIV/AIDS, sexual transmission infections, cancer awareness  or any other  projects that can benefit students and people of Mafinga. The school is also in desperate need of educational books, school stationary materials, computer(s), laboratory equipment, food, clothes, and sports equipment. 

Each and every donor is unique and appreciated. Donations, no matter how small, can change lives. Any donation you make to the TYM organization, will significantly impact the lives of children in Mafinga. Donors will also have a chance to get to know the children of Mafinga and to learn how the building of these dormitories will change their lives. Please don’t hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns.

story:
Hi Everybody! While I'm here in Santa Fe I would love to learn from Tias and Surya Little, two brilliant teachers who weave the ancient traditions of Buddhism and yoga asana with our modern life. It is my dream to teach my massage clients and folks living in alternative communities.

My dreams of teaching have been alive since I was 12 when I discovered I could positively impact people through this ancient practice. On a personal level yoga has-been a source of great transformation into an empowered and positive detached from years of struggling with depression, anxiety, and trauma.

I had grown up feeling very out of body and out of control of my body. I was told everything was wrong with me, that I had ADHD, anxiety, sensory adaption disorder, claustrophia, and depression all by the age of twelve. Soon after being prescribed Ritalin, Seroquel, and Effexor I found myself feeling more out of my body. My adrenals were always kicking and I was convinced that my body was broken because I could never relax. 

My first teacher Sara taught Hatha, a simple and relaxing practice. When I stretched in my first down dog I felt so right! I found my next teacher Val when I was 16. She taught Ashtanga and would meet with me privately to help me establish a personalized daily routine. She taught me mantra which felt incredible to recite.

I taught my first group of students the following summer in Israel while on a teen tour. I was surprised by my confidence and the turnout. All throughout my teens I was on major pharmaceuticals that clouded my sense of confidence. Teaching yoga to teens suddenly boosted my belief in my individual power.

After my father died I came home for a while from college. I was given a new drug to numb my senses that actually sent me to sleep for nearly 16 hours of the day. Within three weeks I took myself off of it and stopped taking every other drug out there - opting to be responsible for my cognitive experiences instead of some chemicals. In place of pharmaceuticals I found Kundalini Yoga, a style that of yoga that offered techniques that would put me in greater control of my bodily experiences. I loved this very much especially because there was a lot of mantras and kriyas that involved hysterically laughing for a sustained period of time. I discovered my favorite Kundalini teacher a few months in. I religiously attended her classes - until one day without any notice she stopped showing up. This was the greatest gain because at the moment I realized I had lost a great teacher, Nevine Michaan, founder of Katonah Yoga was teaching a new class at the time my old teacher used to teach. Nevine motions to me to come in with her full inviting presence and I felt fear. I felt fear because at a subtle level I could tell something big was about to happen.

The next week I arrived at Katonah Yoga and got "checked out." From head to toe the teacher described where I used and didn't use my body based on how I was sitting. I was amazed! I attended class religiously for the summer. Here at Katonah Yoga was a journey into the heart of what yoga is really about... transformation! Nevine and the other teachers taught me the language of yoga is more than just a bunch of postures you can do, rather, the postures are based on archetypes of self-mastery. This requires a deep humbleness and willingness to receive instruction, to overcome neural patterns of using our bodies and find we no longer need the emotional protection. Nevine taught all of this with rich metaphors, a sense of human geometry, finding blind spots, and a deep importance for community.She is my first and foremost teacher and I thank her deeply for her work with me!


A part of Nevine's authenticity is she does not offer teacher trainings. Nevine highly recommended Tias and Surya's Prajna Yoga teacher training whose yoga style has resonated with me at a personal level.

I have been in massage school for the past 6 months and discovering a key component of the work is giving self-care assignments to clients. Having a familiarity of the benefits of yoga postures and their histories will supplement my body work practice greatly by offering tangible changes available to my clients.

Your financial investment insures I continue through massage school comfortably and afford the $4,000 yoga teacher training program I have registered and begun payment for.

By supporting my campaign you keep me from dumpster diving for all of my meals for the next six months.

 Yoga has taught me that being prepared in life and having a good container for life's blessings takes a little effort and formal instruction. Then the grace comes pouring in!

Thank you and much love, Caitlin

story:
POOLSIDE Professional Service Exchange is a hub for tax, accounting, and business consulting professionals to share insights and promote their specialized knowledge and abilities. Here, professionals post articles, events, and asides as well as access the POOLSIDE service exchanges for project bidding.

Professionals are invited to post to POOLSIDE and bid with POOLSIDE services exchanges for free.

POOLSIDE service exchanges provide a simple, unique project-bidding platform for individuals, businesses, and organizations in need of professional services to post their projects for competing bids for free. These users access POOLSIDE to compare professionals' bios, insights, and experience to determine the best bid for their project.

Visit www.poolsideserviceexchange.com

Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends and colleagues about this great new service!
  • Don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

   

Michael Hood, founder

"POOLSIDE is the innovation missing from the public accounting industry."

MS Taxation candidate

     Bentley University, Waltham, MA

BS Accounting

     Mount Saint Mary College, Newburgh, NY

Founder

     Shaker Technology Company

story:
Zur deutschen Übersetzung

About Me

Selam!

I am Addis and I recently got accepted at the Frankfurt School of Finance and Management to pursue a two years Master in International Business with a regional specialization on Africa. Frankfurt School offered me a scholarship of 20.000 Euro to cover 80% of the tuition fee with the condition that I pay the remaining 20%, plus cover my living expenses. I am able to meet the first condition, but so far it’s impossible for me to cover my living expenses. Based on German regulations, a foreign student must have at least 8000€ which should cover all costs for one year.

Despite my financial difficulties I refuse to quit on my ambition. I want to do my MIB at Frankfurt School in order to contribute to my continent’s development. The regional specialization during my studies will enable me to understand business and economic aspects within Africa and to apply my knowledge accordingly. This is why I decided to address a broader audience with a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo in order to acquire the necessary funds.

My Goal: A Democratic Scholarship That Provides Opportunities For Others

This campaign is not just about me. I believe it’s time to change the rules of the game and create a “scholarship” opportunity in the most democratic way possible: Raising funds for education through a crowdfunding campaign enables each side, funders and future potentials to contribute to future change by their respective means. In order to create change we need to help young potentials to overcome the obstacles that have nothing to do with their abilities, but the fact on which continent they were born.

In the near future I therefore want to provide a platform, “fundmystudies”, to young people who face similar challenges so that they can find the necessary support to tell their story to the international community. You can find more information about the project idea here.

Your Word Out There Matters

If you like my campaign and my project idea please support me and spread the word!

Learn More

Follow the campaign on Facebook & Twitter

Meet the fundmystudies team & the people who helped me realising this campaign.

Thank You!


FAQs:

Deutsche Übersetzung hier

I. Do I need a PayPal account to make a contribution?

No. All you need is a credit or a debit-card. You can then make a secure payment by using the PayPal “guest payment” option. Once you click on the button to make a contribution, you’ll be guided through the process.

II. Why is the funding goal 9120€ when I need only around 8000€ to cover my living expenses?

The funding goal of 9120€ is calculated on the basis of the required amount of 8000€ plus the fees charged by Indiegogo (4-9%) and the transaction fees that apply after the completion of the campaign (3-5%).

III. What will happen with the raised money if I do not reach the funding goal?

Based on the principles of "Flexible Funding" I will receive the raised funds regardless of the campaign's success. I decided for "Flexible Funding" because I will of course try to find ways to raise the lacking amount in case I will not reach the funding goal fully. However, should I not be able to start my studies in Frankfurt this autumn, I will return the money to the contributors.

IV. How can you be sure that I will use the money accordingly?

After the end of the campaign the raised money will be transferred on the German bank account of the campaign’s team member, Eva Hanau. In case I am successful and have the sufficient amount to apply for a student visa, the money will be transferred to a "blocked account" of Deutsche Bank in Germany, which every foreign student has to use in order to be granted a student visa to Germany. The account allows me to withdraw 670€ monthly.

V. 8000€ is a lot of money. Why can’t I just do a similar Master in Ethiopia?

I don’t think that I am an exception when I strive for the best possible education that I can acquire. I’ve come a long way and I’ve successfully passed the assessment procedure of Frankfurt School, one of Germany’s leading business schools with a strong international focus. Comparable programmes are not available in Ethiopia, nor will any Master programme in Ethiopia enable me to have the exposure to an international environment which allows me to gain all the experiences and skills while studying abroad. Therefore I am sure that this money is well-invested.

my campaign and my project idea please support me and spread the word!Learn MoreFollow the campaign on Facebook & TwitterMeet the fundmystudies team & the people who helped me realising this campaign.Thank You!
FAQs: Deutsche Übersetzung hier 
I. Do I need
a PayPal account to make a contribution? 
No. All you
need is a credit or a debit-card. You can then make a secure payment
by using the PayPal “guest payment” option. Once you click on the button to
make a contribution, you’ll be guided through the process.
II. Why is
the funding goal 9120€ when I need only around 8000€ to cover my living
expenses?
The funding
goal of 9120€ is calculated on the basis of the required amount of 8000€ plus
the fees charged by Indiegogo (4-9%) and the transaction fees that apply after
the completion of the campaign (3-5%).
III. What
will happen with the raised money if I do not reach the funding goal? 
Based on the
principles of "Flexible Funding" I will receive the raised funds
regardless of the campaign's success. I decided for "Flexible
Funding" because I will of course try to find ways to raise the lacking
amount in case I will not reach the funding goal fully. However, should I not
be able to start my studies in Frankfurt this autumn, I will return the money
to the contributors. 

IV. How can
you be sure that I will use the money accordingly?
After the
end of the campaign the raised money will be transferred on the German bank
account of the campaign’s team member, Eva Hanau. In case I am successful and have the sufficient amount to apply
for a student visa, the money will be transferred to a "blocked
account" of Deutsche Bank in Germany, which every foreign student has to
use in order to be granted a student visa to Germany. The account allows me to
withdraw 670€ monthly. V. 8000€ is a lot of money. Why can’t I just do a similar Master in Ethiopia? I don’t think that I am an exception when I
strive for the best possible education that I can acquire. I’ve come a long way
and I’ve successfully passed the assessment procedure of Frankfurt School, one
of Germany’s leading business schools with a strong international focus.
Comparable programmes are not available in Ethiopia, nor will any Master
programme in Ethiopia enable me to have the exposure to an international
environment which allows me to gain all the experiences and skills while
studying abroad. Therefore I am sure that this money is well-invested.

story:
Aprende tecnicas de destrucción para Efectos Visuales con Houdini

The Art of Destruction es un curso especializado en mostrar distintas técnicas para la realización de efectos visuales de destrucción utilizando Houdini como sofware principal.

The Art of Destruction es el primero de una serie de cursos que conforman el proyecto Houdini TD Series**.

El contenido de este curso esta estructurado en distintas lecciones en formato vídeo de alta calidad (FullHD 1080P) para que no te pierdas un detalle.

Las primeras lecciones del curso ya están disponibles de forma gratuita en Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/channels/artofdestruction

The Art of Destruction es un curso gratuito, las lecciones estarán accesibles de forma gratuita mediante Vimeo. Sin embargo, para aquellos que queráis echar un cable, o queráis tomaros mas en serio este curso, he creado esta campaña en Indiegogo con varias opciones disponibles. 

Recordad que el acceso a las lecciones en video, es gratuito, no es necesario ningún pago de ningún tipo para acceder a ellas, unicamente tenéis que subscribiros al canal de Vimeo para acceder a ellas de forma totalmente gratuita.

Para aquellos que esteis interesados en un aprendizaje más intenso, tenéis la opción "I'm serious about learning". Esta opción incluye la realización de dos proyectos mentorizados, uno de ellos común para todos los alumnos, el segundo, sera un proyecto acordado entre instructor y alumno.

Las plazas son limitadas,  los primeros 15 inscritos podréis disfrutar de un precio especial de 150€, una vez completas las primeras  15 inscripciones, el precio sera de 250€.

CONTENIDOS DEL CURSO:
NOTA: La siguiente es una lista orientativa y simplificada de los temas que se mostraran durante el curso.

-Fracturas.
-Rigid Body Dinamics.
-Bullet Solver.
-Constraints.
-SOP Solvers.
-Atributos. Acceso a datos SOP->DOP->SOP
-Interacción con Particulas.
-Interacción con Fluidos.
-Tecnicas de Destrucción a Gran escala.
-Control Creativo  : The Art of Destruction.

¿PORQUE UNA CAMPAÑA DE CROWDFUNDING?
Hace tiempo que queria hacer este curso, por desgracia no dispongo de todo el tiempo necesario para poder dedicarme a grabar todo el curso de una vez, asi que mi intención es ir ofreciendo las lecciones de forma abierta y progresivamente.

El objectivo de la campaña es reunir un minimo de fondos que me permitan dedicarme "full-time" a grabar todo el curso y empezar a desarrollar el siguiente volumen "The Art of Explosions". Los fondos recaudados tambien me permitiran disponer de un sitio web propio donde hospedar los videos y el material , foros, etc. y crear una comunidad activa de usuarios especializada en Efectos Visuales 

RECOMPENSAS:

Para todos los que participies en esta campaña, independientemente de la recompensa escogida.

-Acceso a los distintos workshops que complementaran este curso
-Acceso a tutoriales complementarios.
-Acceso gratuito al nuevo curso  The Art of Explosions. Fire , Dust and Smoke*

I want to help
-Acceso gratuito a los videos del curso y archivos complementarios.

I'm an entusiast
-Acceso gratuito a los videos del curso y archivos complementarios.

-Certificado de participación.
-Acceso a foros de soporte donde plantear tus dudas.

I'm Serious about Learning

-Oferta limita a 15 plazas.
-Acceso gratuito a los videos del curso y archivos complementarios.
-Certificado de participación.
-Acceso a foros para realizar consultas relacionadas con el curso.
-Realización de una practica mentorizada.
-Certificado de aprovechamiento al finalizar con exito la practica.

Para este curso, he creado un grupo en Facebook, donde podéis apuntaros de forma gratuita.

facebook.com/groups/ArtOfDestruction/

*The Art of Explosions. Fires, Dust and Smoke es el segundo curso en la serie Houdini TD Series que estoy desarrollando.

**Houdini TD Series estara formado por 4 cursos:
-The Art of Destruction - Curso enfocado al uso de dinamicas.
-The Art of Explosions - Curso enfocado a fluidos dinamicos.
-The Art of Fluids - Curso enfocado al trabajo con liquidos.
-The Art of VEX - El ultimo curso de la serie, es la hora de ponerse serios.

story:
What they're saying about us...

"...Love this family!" -

               

                                     "...would love to see some OMG moments!" -

                                                                                                           

                    "What a lovely family..." -

                                                                     


THE KIDS ARE ALL WRIGHT

Help bring this Docuseries to television or other media outlets and share the Wright's story with the world!   The show has a veteran production company behind it with 20 years in Hollywood and credits like The Little Couple & Modern Marvels. The Kids Are All Wright is currently under review at several networks - we need to create a buzz and prove there is an audience for Down Syndrome. 

Watch the promo Supertease for this series here 


Teen sisters Lillie & Emma Grace are remarkable on so many levels - their story is poignant with a future that seems to have already been written. They love their Siblings with Down Syndrome so much that they both feel having children of their own with Downs one day would be great - they claim they'd even adopt a baby or two with Downs one day!  15 & 16 year old girls have enough to think about between school, hair, clothes, and boys - throw a 5 and 10 year old brother & sister with Downs in the mix and things can quickly fly out of control! One sister values her quiet time and the other feels an obligation to help with a 10 year old's diapers. The contrast creates chaos and sisterly love can sometimes be stressed into a hard slap. Watch how this family overcomes the odds on a daily basis and manages the bumps and bruises along the way.

  • The production company: KMG has over 20 years in Hollywood  (kmgroupla.com) working on shows like The Little Couple, Modern Marvels, Rock of Love and the Surreal Life. KMG is working pro bono to bring The Kids Are All Wright to the world and show how life with Down Syndrome is challenging, rewarding and also wonderful! KMG has already committed over $700,000 of their own funds to help finance the first 3 episodes of the series.
  • Your support will bring this show to media and broadcast outlets so that it may not only entertain, educate and endear you, the audience, but also serve as a guide to those who need to learn more about Down Syndrome. We hope you will help - even a dollar makes a difference!

Give a little - Get A LOT!

  • The cost of promotion and distribution is very expensive in the world of TV and media.  On top of weekly episodes there are weekly promos and webisodes to edit, create and bring to the public.  It's a big job to create awareness and gain viewership.  We'll need to raise $400,000 to kick off this series with a strong focus on our first three episodes.   Each episode's budget, depending on locations,  will be between $175K - $250K and  there will also be PR and  distribution costs required to bring it to the public.  The production company has already committed their own funds to help launch the show but we must expose the show to A LOT of people and we need a network to pick up episodes to continue producing the docuseries.  We would love your help in making all this happen.  The audience determines if The Kids Are All Wright will be a series hit - create this season with us and many more to come!
  • As little as a dollar gets you a BIG high five - or a little high five! Beau & Bitty digital high fives can be shared over and over.  Wireless Dance Parties, T-shirts, Sleepy Hollow Sleepovers, DVDs & More - lots to pick from!  Check out the perks and of course we are open to suggestions if anyone would like us to add to the perk pile!
  • If we aren't able to reach goal, the funds will continue to support the show in every way possible regardless - every penny.  We want this show to happen and we hope you do too!

IT STARTS WITH A VOICE - YOUR VOICE MATTERS

Down Syndrome is so common yet many people really don't understand what it's all about.  The Kids Are All Wright is a show that will help people "get it" through these 4 kids' daily lives.

Watch this video featuring a song their mom wrote and their Dad sings!

 

Emma Grace and Lillie are teen sisters who are challenged by everyday normal teen stuff and are affected daily by siblings Beau (10) and Bitty (5) who were both born with Down Syndrome. Through your support to bring their experience to the world - many people will come to understand that Downs is actually more "UP" than ever before.  The condition has come a long way from things like forced sterilization (as recently as the 80s) but there are bigger challenges ahead - like extinction.  People who don't fully understand Downs are testing and terminating Downs pregnancies faster than ever before.  Downs is basically an extra chromosome that creates a very special individual.  Those who have friends, students or family members with Downs are horrified to think it's a possibility that the human race could create a world where Down Syndrome no longer exists.

Our Challenges

We have a few - some people just don't understand the subject matter or they're afraid of what they don't know.  Down Syndrome can be awkward for people - we get that.  The show is currently under review at several networks and even some of them seem to be unsure about the subject of Downs.  We want to show them that there are A LOT of people out there who will watch and support this series! Help us by supporting the show and letting them know you will tune in!  Enough support from all of you will prove to the US and International broadcasters that the public demand for this reality series is REAL and that will translate into many more episodes and many seasons!

Win some $$ even If you can't give any!

We understand some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't get involved!

  • Help us spread the word about our campaign by sharing the Indiegogo links so we can keep track of your support and win $$! Yes - we are giving away special cash prizes to those who share and spread our campaign the most. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools! Maybe your school, church or other organization you know or belong to can help!
  • Most importantly: Spread the Word to End the (R) Word!  Learn all you can and teach others how important an extra chromosome can be!
