story:
Yes, the crowdfunding-campaign is finished BUT there are still a couple of enthousiasts that are working to raise more:

24/06/2017 - @ Hasselt, Belgium: Tim & 4 former scouting-leaders will organize a benefit party for all former leaders, Lao style and the profits will go towards the Thirsty Trees:

they raised in total 654,25 euro = 745.615 US dollar

 

5/07/2017: Heidi C. from Belgium donated 150,00 euro = 170.06 dollar. Thank you Heidi!

7/07/2017: Bart K. from Belgium donated 45,75 euro = 52.1737 dollar. Thank you Bart!

 

If you have an idea or initiative, contact us @ indiegogo@fruitfriendslaos.org!

 

 

For over 4 years volunteers from all over the world have worked side by side in our garden. Now we will lose our hard work due to low occupancy rate at our Fairstay. This was supposed to provide enough funds to pay for the rent, the garden staff and further investments.

We want to raise funds to keep the rights to our garden, re-hire Onkeo our gardener and make improvements so that more people can experience Vang Vieng, the mountains and of course the Lao culture through the local Fruitfriends Lao-team.

 

FruitFriends is a Lao non-profit organization that works in agriculture. Income is used to establish local community projects based on education.

Contributing to Fruitfriends Laos is helping Lao people with giving them a real live example that you still can have fruittrees and plants without using an abundance of chemicals. This tiny landlocked nation is being dwarfed by neighbours like China, Thailand and Vietnam, and it is almost irresistable not to use chemicals in order to try to compete... But at what cost?

We are establishing a botanical biological garden in the enchanting background of the Vang Vieng mountains. This garden hosts plants and fruittrees used in everyday Laos  BUT water is becoming more and more scarce and our current well is literally running dry.

Now we are faced with an even more important issue: losing our garden, Onkeo our gardener, all our work and all the previous investments we already did in the garden.

That is why Fruitfriends Laos calls for your attention.

We need to get our garden back and try to make sure that it stays that way!

As our campaign progresses, we will update our perks. Some of them are still hidden...

We even have some Lao surprises that will be released when we reach certain targets...
 

Sai - operation manager

 

Onkeo - garden and labor officer (currently on leave due to unsufficient funding)

 

On & Vaed - local interns

 

 

Boun - home administrator (and more importantly responsible for delicious Lao meals)

 

 

As you can see, the first 3 years will already add up to 21 300 dollars.

Since only 10,5 years of rent will equal the buying price of the land (31 500 dollars), we dream of buying the land. That way we can ensure the continuation of our garden, use more funding for our other educational projects while incorperating the garden in our educational vision.

We don't like the idea of all our hard work from the past, and hopefully from the future to just go to the owner of the land. We want to be the literal owners of our fruits of labor.

 

The Impact

As we are dependent on funds that are generated by volunteers or guests who stay at our Fairstay, our means to invest in the garden are very limited. Through this campaign we would like to raise awareness but also try to raise funds to make a thorough investment in the garden so that the trees grow stronger and their roots can grow deeper.

Fruitfriends  Laos is not a very big but definitely a transparant  organization. We have a local Laotian team and are founded by a Belgian-Laotian couple.

Everybody who visits Laos is amazed by the enormous diversity of vegetables, fruits and non-timber-forest-products that are part of the daily life of Lao people. Our garden only represents only a small segment of that diversity.

Through our garden we have two goals to accomplish:

  1. Income generation by easy accessibility for (foreign) visitors in order to promote biological farming
  2. Easy accessibility for local farmers in order to promote biological farming in the area

 

The Garden

A lot of Lao people use a 'slash and burn'-method in order to clear land. The problem with this method is that all the nutrients disappear and afterwards the remaining soil is dry and very poor.

In the garden itself, we are looking at the future. We want to establish a sustainable 'food forest' but in order to do this we first need to have sufficient trees to provide a protective layer for the smaller layers. These trees need to grow before anything else can be possible. We believe in restoring the soil.

Our trees have many purposes:

  • create a greater resistance against heavy rainfall or droughts
  • provide a larger amount of biomass to return to the soil (leaves, branches, fruit,...)
  • their roots will capture more nutrients in the soil
  • these roots will imrove the soil structure
  • prevention of erosion
  • preservation of water in the soil through their roots

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't contribute? Bo bpen nyang as we say here or no problem :), but spread the word! Maybe you know people who can contribute.

Also, we will update the perks & media, so keep coming back to see what has changed.

Make your trip to Laos or Southeast Asia for example unforgettable by combining this with a stay @ Fruitfriends Laos. Either as a volunteer or just as a guest to experience Lao culture and the beauty that is Vang Vieng.

We have already established educational infrastructures in two villages, see below.

 For more information: http://www.fruitfriendslaos.org

Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/FruitFriendsLaos

In order to keep the rights to the garden and be able to water the plants for the next year, we need to gather 9000 dollars in total. If we do not reach this goal, well, first of all, we at Fruitfriends Laos will be very, very, very sad. This because we have lost the garden and also a good friend, Onkeo.

 

Where will my contribution go to, since there is no more garden?

Luckely Fruitfriends Laos has another destination for your support: investing in the building of a new school in a rural community of Vang Vieng. And we will update our campaignpage so to have our loyal supporters know where their contributions went to.

 

What about my perks?

Perks requiring the presence of the garden or Onkeo can of course not be fullfilled, since we have lost te garden. We will do our best to fullfill the other perks as soon as the campaign ends.

 

Is Fruitfriends Laos a non-profit organisation?

Yes, definitely but for technical reasons we can not use this titel in our indiegogo-campaign, since only US-bases non-profit-organisations can do this as they have to provide a Tax Identification Number (EIN or Employer Identity Number)... and we really don't have this as a Laos-based non-profit organisation. Hopefully this in the future non-US non-profits will be able to register on Indiegogo as well.

story:
RoboRAVE International Colombia 2017 is a robotics competition for kids of all ages that promotes the learning of skills in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) to meet the global challenge for new talent in these areas, especially for women - to pursue careers related to STEM.

 

Our players involved in RoboRAVE International are allowed to use any type of robot platform. We also encourage them to participate in other competitions to gain a well rounded understanding of robotics applications, platforms, and coding.

Our Values

  • Fun while Learning
  • Sharing
  • Teamwork

Open Platform

  • ANY Hardware,
  • ANY Software
  • ANYONE from ANYWHERE

Which countries do they attend?

RoboRAVE now has 17 countries participating worldwide. Countries such as the United States, Mexico, Japan, China, Czech Republic, Colombia, France, Spain, Argentina, Nigeria, Slovakia, Egypt, Turkmenistan, Canada, India and Germany to mention a FEW!

Who participates in RoboRAVE International 2017?

In RoboRAVE International Colombia 2017 the robot challenges will include 4 categories: Elementary School (grades 3-5), Middle School (grades 6-8), High School (grades 9-12) and Big Kids (anyone beyond HS).

 

With your support, we can help support many more kids, throughout our family of events, to learn the skills that will help them pursue careers in STEM. The future leaders are the ones that need to be critical thinkers, innovators, and community members...these are the skills our kids are gaining by being involved with RoboRAVE International!

Our Team

Director International: Russ Fisher-Ives

Contact: russ@gotoif.org

President and Founder of Inquiry Facilitators, Inc. Russ Fisher-Ives is also director of Global Programs for RoboRAVE International. A former hard-rock geologist and the founding head of the SciMatics Academy at Rio Rancho High School, Russ taught math and science in New Mexico high schools for twenty-three years. He was one of the three teachers that founded the NM RoboRAVE in 2001. In 2006, NM RoboRAVE became RoboRAVE International to reflect the growth into other countries, starting with Mexico in 2004.

 

Director RoboRAVE Colombia 2017: Alejandro Martínez
Contact: amartinez@pygmalionrobotics.com

Ceo and co-founder of Pygmalion Robotics, is a social entrepreneur and, electronic engineer, dedicated to the Technology Education, has leadered for 4 times the RoboRAVE Latinoamerica with 500 teams of studens and programs for students in Colombia teaching near of 15.000 students in educational robotics, tha learn programming, electronics, mechanics, teamwork, and more.

North America

RoboRAVE US, Director: Brian Montoya, Contact: brian@gotoif.org

RoboRAVE California, Director: Chendra Girikipati, Contact: cgarikipati@minervalearning.net

RoboRAVE Colorado, Director: Amy Henschen, Contact: amy.henschen@colostate.edu

RoboRAVE Texas, Director: Shane Haggerty & Liza Montelongo, Contact: shane@epstem.org, liza@epstem.org

RoboRAVE Missouri, Director: Annette Alberts, Contact: labspacerobotics@gmail.com

RoboRAVE New Jersey, Director: Joey Agabiti, Contact: joeagabiti@gmail.com

RoboRAVE Indigenous, Director: JoEllen Kinnamon, Contact: jkinnamon@sacatonschools.org

RoboRAVE Arkansas, Director: Scott Pursley, Contact: scott.j.pursley@gmail.com

RoboRAVE Canada, Director: Chris Zhang, Contact: head@roboca.org

Central America

RoboRAVE Mexico, Director: Vania Mora, Contact: vania_mora@hotmail.com

RoboRAVE Jalisco, Director: Francisco Castaneda, Contact: francisco@clusterobotica.mx

 

South America

RoboRAVE Colombia - Latinamerica, Director: Alejandro Martínez, Contact: amartinez@pygmalionrobotics.com

Europe

RoboRAVE Iberica, Director: Juan Jose Ortega Perez, Contact: badajozrobotica@gmail.com

story_txt:
RoboRAVE International Colombia 2017 is a robotics competition for kids of all ages that promotes the learning of skills in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) to meet the global challenge for new talent in these areas, especially for women - to pursue careers related to STEM. Our players involved in RoboRAVE International are allowed to use any type of robot platform. We also encourage them to participate in other competitions to gain a well rounded understanding of robotics applications, platforms, and coding.Our Values
Fun while Learning
Sharing
Teamwork
Open Platform
ANY Hardware,
ANY Software
ANYONE from ANYWHERE
Which countries do they attend?RoboRAVE now has 17 countries participating worldwide. Countries such as the United States, Mexico, Japan, China, Czech Republic, Colombia, France, Spain, Argentina, Nigeria, Slovakia, Egypt, Turkmenistan, Canada, India and Germany to mention a FEW!Who participates in RoboRAVE International 2017?In RoboRAVE International Colombia 2017 the robot challenges will include 4 categories: Elementary School (grades 3-5), Middle School (grades 6-8), High School (grades 9-12) and Big Kids (anyone beyond HS). With your support, we can help support many more kids, throughout our family of events, to learn the skills that will help them pursue careers in STEM. The future leaders are the ones that need to be critical thinkers, innovators, and community members...these are the skills our kids are gaining by being involved with RoboRAVE International!Our TeamDirector International: Russ Fisher-IvesContact: russ@gotoif.orgPresident and Founder of Inquiry Facilitators, Inc. Russ Fisher-Ives is also director of Global Programs for RoboRAVE International. A former hard-rock geologist and the founding head of the SciMatics Academy at Rio Rancho High School, Russ taught math and science in New Mexico high schools for twenty-three years. He was one of the three teachers that founded the NM RoboRAVE in 2001. In 2006, NM RoboRAVE became RoboRAVE International to reflect the growth into other countries, starting with Mexico in 2004. Director RoboRAVE Colombia 2017: Alejandro MartínezContact: amartinez@pygmalionrobotics.comCeo and co-founder of Pygmalion Robotics, is a social entrepreneur and, electronic engineer, dedicated to the Technology Education, has leadered for 4 times the RoboRAVE Latinoamerica with 500 teams of studens and programs for students in Colombia teaching near of 15.000 students in educational robotics, tha learn programming, electronics, mechanics, teamwork, and more.North AmericaRoboRAVE US, Director: Brian Montoya, Contact: brian@gotoif.orgRoboRAVE California, Director: Chendra Girikipati, Contact: cgarikipati@minervalearning.netRoboRAVE Colorado, Director: Amy Henschen, Contact: amy.henschen@colostate.eduRoboRAVE Texas, Director: Shane Haggerty & Liza Montelongo, Contact: shane@epstem.org, liza@epstem.orgRoboRAVE Missouri, Director: Annette Alberts, Contact: labspacerobotics@gmail.comRoboRAVE New Jersey, Director: Joey Agabiti, Contact: joeagabiti@gmail.comRoboRAVE Indigenous, Director: JoEllen Kinnamon, Contact: jkinnamon@sacatonschools.orgRoboRAVE Arkansas, Director: Scott Pursley, Contact: scott.j.pursley@gmail.comRoboRAVE Canada, Director: Chris Zhang, Contact: head@roboca.orgCentral AmericaRoboRAVE Mexico, Director: Vania Mora, Contact: vania_mora@hotmail.comRoboRAVE Jalisco, Director: Francisco Castaneda, Contact: francisco@clusterobotica.mx South AmericaRoboRAVE Colombia - Latinamerica, Director: Alejandro Martínez, Contact: amartinez@pygmalionrobotics.comEuropeRoboRAVE Iberica, Director: Juan Jose Ortega Perez, Contact: badajozrobotica@gmail.comRoboRAVE Craon - France, Director: Cyril Geslin, Contact: cyril.geslin@gmail.comRoboRAVE Germany, Director: Lars Moellendorf, Contact: moellendorf@phaenovum.deRoboRAVE Czech Republic, Director: Ing.
